I first gave this show a try because it looked really interesting when I saw the first trailer But after watching the first episode and so on,it started to feel like the writers are huge doctor who fans and justice league fans and wanted to combine the both to make the legends of tomorrow The show has a lot of thing that resemble a lot from doctor who like the time masters are like time lords,Vandal Savage seems like the master who is the arch-enemy of the doctor,the ship the legends are on resembles the tardis if the tardis was an actual ship,Rip Hunter seems like a rip-off of the doctor and fun fact, the guy who plays as Rip Hunter actually played as an companion who's name also begins with an r And most of the characters I used to like from other shows(White Canary,The Atom,Jax/Firestorm,Captain Cold,Heat Wave,and Green Arrow) really annoy me now So thanks for ruining a bunch of great characters on one show The CW This is why you(The CW) can only have a soap-opera feeling and it can influence your superhero shows also

A wannabe cross between superheroes and Dr Who  What's wrong? To start off, you have the Atom which is one of the most powerful heroes in the DC universe and he's rarely in his super suit  The team gets into trouble constantly and there the Atom is without his suit  Mainly the characters act stupidly in stupid situations  It is the typical we've got to save the earth situation but somehow it's become a love / human interest story were the mission is the highest priority but somehow that priority is constantly compromised I will make it to near the end of the first season  At the beginning of the series the time line seems to be important  Now it is out the window  No more checking  Characters that were to be killed are stupidly not killed for contrived reasons  The writers must of just totally given up Don't waste your time  I'm stuck watching it with my wife to catch glimpses of the former Superman actor

Lazy writing  The only reason I gave this a shot was because of a cross series link - 'Invasion' - part of which was The Flash, Arrow, and then this  Became aware of this in advance and thought I would need to see Legends of Tomorrow for it to make any sense  No - I didn't 'Invasion' didn't need me to have any additional 'Legends' backstory Then I just thought I may as well finish it - and went on to let it waste more of my time There are some elements that are worth mentioning, in a positive light - I liked Season 1's enemy, I also liked the lead enemy in Season 2 There are also some better 'Legend' characters in Season 2, swapping out two very tiresome elements from Season 1, being careful about spoilers, but if you've watched it you might know who I'm referring to  Otherwise it's little more than a pile of stinking garbage The series' play on time travel is so poorly executed, and ill thought out, that I think, in addition to some shoddy dialogue and characters, is the main reason this show has, in my estimation, fallen flat on it's stupid face

Season 1 of Legends of Tomorrow was very average to below average at times, If I had to give it a number it would be about a 6, Savage just didn't do it for me as a villain  Season 2 is much better in every way  I recommend anyone who gave up on it after season 1 to give it one more chance with season 2

I genuinely think that DC's Legends of Tomorrow is underrated  It is a step in the right direction for CW's television universe  The show as a whole brings under-used characters from The Flash and Arrow and gives them a chance to be focused on and developed  The story line in the two seasons can be somewhat confusing, but when made sense of, is very enjoyable and gripping  My personal favourite character is Sara Lance, as she is a strong, a natural born leader and a great captain of the wave rider  She brings order, discipline and a sense of hope to the Legends  I personally believe that Rip Hunter should have played a bigger and more effective role in season 2  Besides all of the positives, there are a couple of negative features that I would like to point out  Some of the acting seems quite stale, as I think that some of the newer members of the cast don't have enough chemistry between themselves  Also, there are minor issues with the CGI used, especially when in the Wave Rider  I personally don't take too much notice of this, but it does sometimes bug me  Besides the few minor criticisms, the program as a whole is great fun to watch and has a story line which will make you want to come back to watch more

Let's be open about  Legends of Tomorrow : Of course the stories are rubbish, and the acting is (with some exceptions) nowhere near Marvel Netflix quality  But this series has something that Arrow (which tries to be incredibly gritty) and Flash (which tries to be incredibly witty) fail to display: Entertainment value! Legends of Tomorrow is like the playground of the Berlantiverse where you can take underused characters or crazy story ideas and make an episode out of it no matter what happened the week before  This is even more so in the second season where the constant need to antagonize Vandal Savage has gone The writers can send their heroes straight through the ages from feudal Japan to the Wild West, from the 80s to the future  There is an overall storyline but that is not what makes this series fun: What makes it fun is the snappy banter of Snart and Rory, the crazy jumping through time trying to save the timeline while having no qualms causing time paradoxes themselves (constantly!) and not giving a damn about making sense  Doesn't sound like a modern TV show? Well that's because it sounds like a classic comic book, existing just to be enjoyed and to have people have fun with it Yes, the bogus stories and the crappy acting may turn many people off  But I'll take Legends of Tomorrow over any season of Arrow with its abysmal flashback story lines (and its own crappy acting) anytime

The overall story-line could have been outstanding, unfortunately there are several VERY powerful flaws that detract from the show unlike what was seen in The Green Arrow or The Flash adaptions 1st there is the major flaw which can be found in the shows premises 'time travel'  This would be great, however    it is time travel through the eyes of ignorant liberals; most of the time periods are either greatly exaggerated to the extent that you either you assume that 'that's REALLY how it was   ' or you ask yourself 'THAT'S really how it was!?'  From the racist, sexist and homophobic 50s to the vile evil of fascist Nazism in the 1940s The sad truth is not only will these ideas constantly bombard the audience as they watch the show however, it will also dumb them down with several dozen historical inaccuracies  My favorite of which are Eistein 'inventing the atomic bomb'(correction his wife invented it, truthfully Julius Robert Oppenheimer had more to do with the invention of the atomic bomb than Eistein, who immediately left the project after realizing what its goals were) and men being nothing but sexist pigs in the 1940s (truthfully during these periods men were more or less 'off cuff' when it came to women, however sexual misconduct was still regarded VERY negatively during this time frame and even though women didn't have as many rights as men at the time, men still had a LOT more manners than would be seen going forward into the 1960s-1980s)  The best of all though, was the overblown and historically inaccurate conception of the 'Nazis' utilizing idiotic premises like 'Super Nazi'(Like most media, the Nazi's or should i say Germans during WWII are CONSTANTLY portrayed as a inferior force or joke often seen as that 'mustache twirling, top hat wearing, twisted smiling villain, who is tying a women to a set of railroad tracks', oh and apparently their only purpose is for some cocky American dude to punch them out    if you really look at history, MOST of the grunts who fought for Hitler did so out of fear(for their families mostly), not subservient idealism and no opposition force in our history has ever been seen as darkly  even their allies, the Japanese got a better pardon from the US than the Germans did    But hey they did give us anime, video games and edible raw fish)  In fact the depiction of the Japanese was even more ridiculous due to their use of 'mixed English' in the entire episode and cultural intolerance Now apart from the terrible history lesson, there are three other HUGE road blocks that get in the way of this show   1) Narrow-Minded Social/Cultural Intolerance; yeah pretty much the show is watered down by it, everything from woman empowerment through male oppression to pro-gay anti-religious sentiment, if you like watching people frick with other people for their beliefs or exaggerate the truth through embellishment then this show must be pretty awesome for ya lol 2)Pro-Gay Propaganda; So    Vixon is no longer 'bi-curious' she is a full blown homosexual, a point which this show will bring up several dozen times a season (almost annoyingly so   )  There is no character that 'randomly' hooks up more than vixen which makes her look not only like a piece of eye candy, but also a total 'skeeze'  As many would find that a bit offensive due to her being a woman expressing sexual liberalism, all she is really doing is solidifying the role that women play as 'sex objects' in society    the worst part is that Vixon is ALSO constantly pushed as a 'role-model' for young women and packaged as a 'strong, confident woman' where she falls flat coming off more like a well    you know 3)Racial Intolerance; although the show features a decently diverse cast    not  Truthfully the show showcases one black male character and two black females (two of which is the results of cultural diversification in comics    (the black firestorm and now a black hawk-girl))  Unfortunately, the black male character seems to ONLY like WHITE chicks    a stereotypical portrayal that dates back to the racially charged times in the good old days  Also sad to say the character is nothing but a running 'look what these crazy white folks are doing now' joke; constantly being thrown into ridiculous situations that 'the white people' got him into Frankly its these faults that make this show only entertaining to the truly 'braindead' and how it got a second season I will never know  The only thing close to its level of arrogance is 'Team America and The World Police'

Thawn could easily kill every single one of the Legends in a minute but he doesn't  The Legends keep making reckless mistakes, and somehow get out of the situation because the Legion of Doom waits so long to pull the trigger  Like just shoot the damn gun and they will die  Worst show ever  The Legends could have easily saved everyone with one change of the past  So much more is wrong with this show, and the mistakes keep repeating and pilling up every single episode

I have just finished the second season of legends of tomorrow and after a bit of a disappointing first season this season improves on it in every way pretty much every way  The premise of the season sees the team scattered across time as with some new help look to stop a group of super villains from capturing an artefact called the spear of destiny  caity lotz reprises her role as Sara lance and she really becomes the main character and captain of the team and I thought she did a really good job  Her character has to deal with some emotional moments due to previous events and it truly does hit when it is meant to  Dominic Purcell as mick Rory is given a larger role this season and similar to Sara he has a hard time dealing with something that happened last season and I found him the funniest and one of the most interesting characters on this show  The returning cast of ray, martin, Jefferson and rip are all still good characters  The new heroes are Nate Haywood/steel and amaya/vixen, I liked both of these characters  At first I thought Nate was a bit over the top and cheesy but he grew on me as the season progresses  Now to the villains, reprising his role from the flash matt letscher is eobard thawne/reverse flash and he is great  He totally sells the role and I have always loved his character and I feel like he was the perfect villain for this season  Also I find Neal McDonough as Damien darkh incredibly entertaining and I really liked watching him  My only negative might be that I feel like John barrowman as Malcolm merlyn is entertaining but ultimately underutilised towards the end of the season  The story of the show moves across more interesting time periods and I just found the characters story arcs more interesting especially as the show progresses  I will say that if you haven't watched all of arrow and the flash then you will be lost especially when it comes to the villains as there motivations are linked to the other shows but for fans it really does work  The script of this show has some decent dramatic qualities that work better then last season and the humour is better, it just does come across as really cheesy at times which does hurt the show  The style of the show has some pretty good action scenes especially when it embraces its more sci fi routes  But this season similar to the first does have episodes that feel like filler for sure  Overall this is one of the best improvements to a series that I have seen and I recommend this season especially if you are a fan of the other shows in this universe

Second season is for me a 9 it is funny and creative  Season 1 was a 6, I mean better than the other TV shows in this universe, but the whole Hawk girl - Vandal Savage story line was awfully boring  They also completely ruined Hawkgirl who was actually a cool character  With them gone though and with the emergence of Sarah as a leader and the team making mistakes and learning along the way season two was really fun to watch  From Rory's obsession with ninja's in medieval japan to 1980s via the zombie confederates and Camelot    My favourite character is Rory  less talking, more doing!  :)

I don't know   I was expecting more, but it didn't hit home at all for me 1  Sara Lance - Her character is all over the place  They made her a captain to make the hard decisions, when in reality all the decisions made were either ad-hoc or by reasonable deduction  Sara was always a solo mindset  I don't see how going from the League of Assassins qualifies you to run a ship that jumps time-lines effectively  That role should have gone to another crew member  You never see her strength as a leader  There were actually times Amaya had much better leader abilities than Sara  And Sara seemed bent on making out with every woman she came across no matter what time period they were in  Sloppy touch  Her actions alone could have compromised several missions  Not the signs of a true leader at all 2  Dr  Stein - Far too many times they make him seem indecisive  I found that hard to watch when in Season 1 he was relied upon heavily to help Jackson get acclimated to his new role and powers   only for now in Season 2 he always struggles within himself  3  Jeffrey Jackson - I have no complaints with his role in the LOT other than he overdoes it   and a lot! They write his character abrasive in many shows, then they soften him up, then they give him credit for making the hard call   it's dysfunctional at best  4  Ray Palmer - of all the LOT'ers,I like him the most  He should have been the leader IMO  He ran a huge company back in Star City, had incentive to correct the time-line the most, but they totally watered down his influence on the show to fit in Sara being captain  Ray has a bit of it all, smarts, decision-making, knowledge, camaraderie, if anyone was fit to gel a team, it was Ray  Missed opportunity for the former Superman to have a lead again   lol5  Mick Rory - Mick has to be the best character of all  He is true to himself, he had THEE best character development of them ALL! You understood his position going back to making him Chronos, getting back to the team, having struggles with Snart, leaving and coming back  Mick was my hero the entire show and his character was the beefiest, most developed of them all IMO 6  Nate Haywood - He actually was a refreshing addition to LOT  He came in with a solid story-line that was maintained the entire season 2  He hit all his marks in terms of his love of history, his grandfather, wanting to address a past he wasn't happy about, but the journey helped him figure out what was more important   and that's all you can expect for guy who inherits superpowers but exudes a real heart  His character was worth the watch 7  Amaya Jiwe - SO underused! This girl's character was a frickin powder keg ready to explode! But every time you'd think they'd write in for her to be a badass? They hand it over to  of course, Sara   and Amaya proved she could make much better decisions than Sara along the way  That was very irritating to watch  I like how the love interest between her and Nate was developed  It would have been nice if she had a chance to actually MEET her granddaughter since everyone else saw their past or future in some manner or another   but oh well  8  Gideon - I think it was wrong for them to materialize Gideon and give her a smack-a-roo session with Rip IMO, but it was nice to see Amy appear on the show  The ONLY 2 things I don't like about how they have Gideon in the show is:1  The way Gideon talks - a little loud and hard to the ear (sometimes I'd have to turn my system down Gideon was so loud, but that was purposed by the producers) and 2  overly-human responses to the team throughout the show kills the tech portion of it 9  Rip Hunter - I liked Rip Hunter's character and wished they had more of him as his old self  But to have him under the influence of the Legion of Doom shouldn't have been as long as it was IMO  And they always found a way to make characters rationalize being on the bad side   it's kind of funny because it's so predictable in film now it gets boring  Though a snooze factor, I enjoyed him throughout Season 2, if not one of the most watchable of all the characters  I do, however, hate how they ended the show  Rip only talks to Sara as he leaves the ship  This is what you do for the most pivotal character of the show? He started with a bang, but end his character with a wimp? Not cool at all  The emotional attachment to Gideon alone deserved a much different ending!10  Legion of Doom - These guys were awesome  End of story  But, the way the story-line flowed was a bit irritating, and that's on the writers, not the actors themselves  But this lineup is a powerhouse and it's hard to watch really good actors playing bad guys go against really bad actors as good guys   well, not all of LOT, but   Other than that, I think I want to watch Season 1 again to remind me why I like this show because I almost stopped watching it once Sara became captain

#Season01The show had potential, then lost it and now it ends with new potential  Still better than #Arrow's Season 04 by a wide margin Basically, an entire season where very little happened in terms of the chronological events in the time-line  And very little good was done  The show was slow, filled with cheesy dialogues and a constant splitting of team which led to more trouble for the team Then, there was this #AncientEgypt mythology which was the centre for the show  Which caused huge discomfort for the #ComicBook origins  Instead of #Hawkgirl and #Hawkman being aliens who are never in love as in comics and don't get reborn, and instead #VandalSavage being a #Caveman gained #Immortality from #Meteor  It was all the wrong way, which led to a weak character portrayal of #Hawkgirl being the centre and key piece In the end, it was relieving to see that the show has distanced themselves from this wrong #Mythology as even the ending episodes had contradicted their earlier established story arcs  But, as the ending was near, the show got good, focusing on wrapping up this wrong path of start and now there is potential once again for #Season02, if there is one One of the key gems of the show, was the lush costumes and set designing and visual effects for a TV show, which led to the show being helped in being held on just long enough to establish itself properly #Season02After a very confused and mangled #Season01, the show has risen from the ashes to deliver a very fun, exciting and humor-filled season, that turned out to be the best of the #DC #TVshows on air, even better than #TheFlash One of the reasons of its #Success, was simply the use of the best charismatic characters of the #ArrowVerse to deliver a dynamic team of villains that really put a whole other level of #Beat on the show, that the other #DCshows are missing (#excluding #Flash's 1st #Season) The show maintained a really good balance of Dark characters and the theme of the show, which is that of a cheerful adventure  But the show never forgot that in the end, the story is dark and the stakes are very much fatal for the #Protagonists Even the #VisualEffects were pretty good this season, and they had to be, as #ReverseFlash's involvement and his grand scheme demanded them to be  The most memorable things this season, were the blurring of lines between different #Genres in reality, involving the use of #StarWars and #TheHobbit Overall, the show was fun and had enough cheesiness in it, to be always being able to deliver #Entertainment, but the show did employ the use of #CommutativeLaw a lot, especially in the end, but it never became too #Goofy  One more amazing thing, was the proper build-up of the story, character arcs and their ends, which only enhanced the story  The most styled character, this show made us realise, was #WhiteCanary, with impressively #Choreographed fight sequences and #BattlePoses, that slayed many #Hearts In the end, a very much recommended show, because of a very entertaining season 02

This could have been good except that the story line was ridiculous and the actors mainly miscast As others have said the main story makes no sense  A rogue time traveller, (so badly cast he was unwatchable most of the time  Arthur Darvill just has zero screen presence and no charisma whatsoever  Who decided to cast him in this?) decides to gather a group of super heroes to help him kill an immortal who has killed his wife and child  Why he didn't just time travel to just before they were killed and take them elsewhere or to a different time is not explained  The group he picks including two criminals with no super powers are all pretty weak and seem incapable of killing this one evil being As the series moves on it becomes more and more frustrating and errors and plot holes abound The only thing that made this watchable was the special effects were pretty good, but that is about it

I have somewhat enjoyed this show, however it has in the last half season been on a religious kick that is making it near unwatchable  The constant references to religious characters and religious ideology make it seem like it is being written not by a fan of comics, but someone trying to push a theocratic agenda under the guised of a TV show  I do realize that religion is fiction in and of itself, but if I wanted to watch my childhood heroes spewing ideological nonsense I would watch a Kirk Cameron movie

People! Give it a break! This show never fails to make me laugh! It's ridiculous, cheesy and a ton of fun  Suspend reality and enjoy the ride- this is not meant for heavy thinking, deep romances or for pondering your role in life  It's fun  The humor is the truly captivating part  You never know where or when it's going to come from, but this show is a hoot- as long as you don't take yourself too seriously  I suggest giving it a try- I think this show has earned it

I'm rating this 7 stars because I enjoy the show very much, but think it can be even better  There is room for improvement, but I will not say it's a terrible show with bad acting and poor writing, because that is not true I've watched since episode one and I have only missed two episodes of the current season, so I think it's fair I write a review  Those that wrote a review based on watching only one episode from the first season have truly missed out!The action and time travel are the best parts of the show, but I think the character development is the second best  We have seen the characters change over time (no pun intended!)  Season 1 felt like more of an experiment, but this season feels like real growth  I want this series to continue because I need more!

It's not at all good  But, yeah, I'm still watching it because I'm a sucker for time travel stories  Part of it stems from being an historian, and part of it stems from heavily influential childhood sci-fi shows and      so long as they keep leaping from life to life, striving to put right what once went wrong and hoping each leap will   Yeah, yeah, yeah  It's time travel and good or bad I'm going to be in its audience just because of that This is why I want the return of the message boards  I mean, how else am I going to find out if Wentworth Miller is obscenely over-acting or if that annoying delivery is just how he talks in real life? I certainly don't care enough to explore it much further than this Did they get sued by the creators of Dr  Who because of Arthur Darvill's depiction of Rip? It seems almost too Dr  Who not have a lawsuit over it Dominic Purcell, the mystery returns, is he really over-acting that much or is his delivery just as naturally annoying as Miller's? Brandon Routh   really dude, you look a little too much like you belong in  Sliders  but that's not your fault Caity Lotz is really the only one here that is believably in the Arrowverse  She doesn't seem like a cartoon villain and she doesn't seem like she's ripped out of the pages of another series I know, I know   Ciara Renée   and again she would have been great in Sliders   but not so much here There is a lot wrong with it but   Time travel   going to keep watching it anyway and overlook all the over-acting and the bits and pieces blatantly ripped out of Classic sci-fi

I really tried to like this series after seeing the pretty high reviews  After watching Season 1 I saw things starting to take shape and characters developing with Leonard Snart ending up one of the most fleshed out ones  Season 2 doesn't seem to build on Season 1 The stories seem to follow the same formula  Travel through time  Screw something up with ineptitude  Scramble to fix what they screwed up  Lather, rinse, repeat Why is it that shows featuring DC characters can not be nearly as well written as their Marvel counterparts? Even the NetFlix hosted ones  Hopefully Wonder Woman will be better than Suicide Squad

Quite possibly the most pointless TV series I've ever had the misfortune of sticking with  A poor man's dr  Who gathers up some cheap rip offs of decent characters to go back in time to eliminate an immortal that killed his family so far in the future it has literally no affect on anyone recruited by him, giving them no reason to go in the first place  Armed with a ridiculous laser revolver that he somehow manages to miss every shot he takes with, this plonker bumbles through time damaging the time line more and more to the point that he ends up 3 days before his family dies taking on savage then(nullifying the entire premise of the  show ) only to again hilariously fail! Want a tip? Don't recruit anyone, go back to a time before savage is immortal/ still a defenceless baby, carry said baby forward through time till you can find a 2x2 box for said baby to rot for all eternity, and call it a day

Oh Rory! The Doctor really left you somewhere surreal! Love superhero stuff but this is so poor  Don't really have anything good to say about it, Poor acting, poor script, poor effects  Arrow started out brilliantly and soon lost the way as it progressed Flash is also losing its way Then you get the Flash/ Arrow crossovers - blink an eye in either series and lose the plot So now we throw them all together along with the baddies and one of Dr Who's lost companions! Sorry, I'm off to watch SHIELD, Supergirl, Agent Carter and of course the Doctor ! Arthur Darvill is such a let down and wrongly cast On a whole - it's just shallow, cheesy and weak!

The first season of this show is so bad that it is hard to know where to begin  It feels like a low-budget series from the 1970's, and not in a time-traveling kind of a way, but rather how the special effects and story-telling goes The first season is bad on a whole new level  Crap beyond crap The second season though has been decently entertaining so far - in the same way paint suddenly drying faster is more entertaining then slow drying paint  The acting has got significantly better and it is almost fun to watch  Almost  I changed my previous rating from a 1 to a 2 just because it has improved a lot from the first season  The show is still bad, very low budget and not very good scripting, but at least it is almost watchable in the 2nd season In general though; nothing really makes sense, the acting is abysmal (1st season especially), the scripts horrible  Why was this crap even created? Who thought that this was a good idea? With the Flash now being one of the worst things on TV, and albeit a good try to rejuvenate Arrow that show too is (still) really bad, I believe that DC should keep to cartoons where they are great and close down these shows which are only embarrassing Do not watch, and if you do; watch the first episode of the first season, then jump directly to the 2nd season, or you can lobotomize yourself first with a rusty nail which may bring some enjoyment

Focuses on time-traveling rogue Rip Hunter, who has to recruit a rag-tag team of heroes and villains to help prevent an apocalypse that could impact not only Earth, but all of time  DC's Legends of Tomorrow suffers from what i can say poor storytelling and over the top acting and with a team of people that simply can't work together that well  My biggest issue with the whole TV show is Dominic Purcell and Wentworth Miller and although they're not bad their characters are just getting boring always arguing and doing the wrong things every single time another huge problem is this whole thing with Casper Crump who plays Randy Savage his role reminds me something like Ultron and Trevor he is supposed to be powerful and all that and yet he gets killed every 10 years and comes back again and this whole time travel thing kinda gets old as well  I stopped watching around episode 6 and i really don't see myself continuing again after all those things i saw every episode is the same jokes, cgi, action and time travel and let's not forget arguments between the same 2 characters  It started pretty well and the cast is fine but after the 1st episode it's getting boring and you will get tired for sure 6 5/10

Just watched the pilot and it did not kick ass or make me want to see episode 2 immediately  Filming and CGI was OK for a series, though with only little effort it would have looked even better  The Waverider ship design looks terrible, the surface textures seem to come from a ten years old pc game  Costumes are OK to badly done, Atoms armor being the best of all  The writing is simple and neither smart nor very entertaining  I have no idea whether the plot is based on comics (I assume it is), nevertheless it can't be a jewel of comics art writing  The names are awful (Rip Hunter, Vandal Who?), the character design and looks are from the stone age  The dialogues follow the same route - a lot of blah blah (the evil super dork even talks to his foot soldiers about his plans, oh my) So actually nothing in this show seems to be non-cliché, which is quite boring  Studios and producers don't have the balls to make a show from comics like DV8  All they dare to do is gulp up the next offspring of already running and successful shows that can be shown at 18 00 and don't offend anyone Too tame, too botched, too flat Edit: OK, I did it and watched episodes 2-4  At least I tried, I had to fast forward a lot to omit terrible lengthy dialogue leading nowhere  This series is awful and so badly done that it's actually an insult  I vote down to 1 star now This is just the tip of the iceberg but here are some major flaws from episode 4 (no spoiler intended):- The bad guys flees into the Soviet Union, the team has no clue where exactly he is hiding in that oh so tiny empire made up from some of the largest countries in the entire world - yet the captain orders the ship to take course into the UDSSR and then suddenly without explanation it's Moscow, what else   The ship falls at a rate of 1000m per second and can still make a flat crash landing without anyone aboard getting injured  We clearly see the ship is not moving vertically when it cuts the engines  That means it's initial velocity is 0  It is shown to fall for about 4-5 seconds only from a height of 5000m, which means it would reach a final speed of about 50m/s ignoring the fact that the air friction and the non-aerodynamical form of the object would slow it even further down  Crashing into the ground with several hundred tons of mass at a speed of let's say 30-40m/s would still not be healthy to ship and crew  But - funny - when they reach the surface the engines are on and the ship is flying horizontally at great speed and still crash landing  We see the ship can easily spiral straight into the sky several times at ease, only this time it can't counter th terrible acceleration of 30 m/s to stabilize it's flight? This is big BS in your face Rip Hunter is the most annoying character I have seen in years  Whatever nonsense he utters it always makes him look like a total idiot  He is a Time Master  How did such an immature, unstable and short-sighted man ever become a Time Master?The glowing handguns that make the wearer a big target while sneaking through the dark forest    and they look like what they are: cheap plastic toy guns  And they have zero reach, too  Yet Snort and his  I always have this sinister expression  friend fire at ranges where they clearly can not hit anything  Doesn't stop them from trying and taking bullets from AK47s as a reward Using an audio mixpanel as controls for a pseudo-scientific installation  One that houses a massive radioactive source in a chamber with glass windows  The chamber could at least have been filled with water, but no And every episode a lot of talk, talk, talk  Nonsense  Insulting  Miserable It got nominated for the Best TV Comic Adapation - this industry is so dumb and rotten

I'm not sure what demographic this show is actually aimed at  There's blood, killing, and death, so I assume it's for a double digit age demographic The problem here is, the show is beyond shallow  The characters are all mentally inept, and the writing is terrible  I won't even get into the plot holes I think my growing distaste for the show finally reached the boiling point with the big countdown box with a BUTTON, magically appearing on a nuke being sold at auction This show was written by 5 year olds, for 5 year olds  Which wouldn't be that bad, if the blood and violence wasn't there  Hence my confusion as to whom this show is aimed at Having just watched the first episode of 'The Tick', that show is Shakespeare compared to this Barney and Friends My teenage daughter is barely able to watch this  I'm trying to find excuses not to watch this About the only redeeming quality here is the budget  There's some OK fighting and shooting  If there wasn't, I would have stopped watching after the 2nd episode

In my complete honest opinion as a comic book fan of DC and Marvel I must truly say that this show is just legendary ha-ha  In other words it is really good and pretty funny  DC fans and followers of The Arrow and The Flash will most definitely enjoy this show because it does have great connections and relations to DC's Arrow and The Flash TV series  Almost the whole cast of this show made their comic book TV series debut firstly on The Arrow then The Flash  Even with out watching Arrow and The Flash true comic book fans would totally enjoy this show  The humour and action is just bad ass  We are all very familiar with Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman and many popular famous faces of The DC comics industry, but not so many are familiar with The Atom, The White Canary, Fire Storm, Captain Cold, Heat Wave, Hawk Man, Hawk Girl, and Rip Hunter  To some you may be quite familiar with these characters but to most they are just seeing these heroes for the very 1st time on the big screen  I like the fact new characters are being introduced to the DC TV universe  There is nothing better then expanding the world of comics  Like I said before if you have watched Arrow and The Flash you definitely will have more of a deeper connection to these characters as you have seen them way before this show was put together and made into a TV series  However to those who have not watched the previous TV series do not get discouraged  This show was made for those familiar with the previous TV shows but it was also definitely made for new viewers who don't even got a clue about DC or the superheroes involved in the TV series  I have gotten many of my friends and family to watch this show and they have no clue where these characters originate from  Proving that this show is for everyone not just hard core comic book fans  The action and comedy alone makes this show what it is, but there are definitely some touchy moments where you do feel sympathy for some characters and begin to develop an emotional attachment to them  Overall I strongly suggest you make some popcorn grab a cold drink, sit back and enjoy the show  You wont be disappointed :)

I tortured myself all the way through the 16 episodes of the first season I had quite high expectations starting this but as soon as i saw the first characters from  Arrow  my expectations dropped by a large margin The concept is great (just like the concept of  Arrow ) but those writers (haven't checked, but it feels like Arrow and Legends of Tomorrow share the same writers team) have a talent to absolutely destroy promising concepts Let me try to summarize an episode(totally spoiler-free!) :Intro - new threat out of nowhere - plot twist in the main-story - hilarious fights including bad CGI - plot twist new fancy equipment/ability with ridiculous name is (re-)discovered / invented - stupid decisions! - plot twist - FEELINGS, kiss, kiss - final fight - plot twist/cliff hanger! - CreditsThis combined with a cast of actors that barely deserve the label  actor  makes this show an impertinence for the average viewer!My advice: Keep your hands off this  Total disappointment!

My first ever review and I really wanted it to be a good one but this show just plain boring and mediocre at best The teaser trailer was much better than the actual thing I must admit  The cast is still good; Brandon Routh could be a little less cheesy in my opinion, Wentworth Miller and Dominic Purcell are a good as can be expected, Arthur Darvill is OK  Honestly, the show could have used a lesser antagonist  That being said I won't be giving up on this show yet  Maybe not expect much from it like I did but I am gonna wait and see nevertheless  Giving it a 5 out of love of the DC characters

I was pretty disappointed with the show to say the least  Granted, I've only seen the first half of the season and I'm told that the last couple of episodes do pick up, but from a critical perspective the show doesn't deliver  Legends of Tomorrow had a great opportunity to be amazing: it's actors are great, in particular Wentworth Miller, Victor Garber and Brandon Routh have all proved their skills as actors, and the show held great potential with the epic stories and histories attached to the characters  However, the show's writing and overall direction doesn't offer anything new or particularly interesting to the superhero genre  Instead, the show falls under clichéd story lines and dialogue without a strong enough villain or a convincingly written character for Rip Hunter to hook a viewer  I found the show's visual direction to be nothing special either - watching the show you can really tell that any hope of a visually appealing or unique show is squandered by the show's low budget and the pressure to churn out episodes for a network However on a positive note, the show is pretty light-hearted and I'm sure will probably entertain a fan of the Berlanti-verse looking for a marathon  Wentworth Miller's performance as Leonard Snart is one of the best things about the show, and the chemistry between the cast is what you should stay for  Overall rating: C+

Season one dealt with Rip Hunter, the time master, trying to eliminate Vandal Savage, who murdered Rip's wife and son I think this story line went on too long, but the writers wisely gave it a conclusion in the season finale Now for the characters, it is just hard to like the Hunter character, though they tried to make him sympathetic  The Kendra and Carter characters just slowed the story and were somewhat silly  Their departure was a good thing at the end The Atom is very likable and reminds you of Christopher Reeves  Also, Professor Stein is good  Snart and Mick also are good characters, too bad the writers killed Snart, bad move About Jefferson, the writers need to develop his personality  At this point, it's almost a generic one Though I am not enthusiastic about season one, I think the second one will be worth checking out  Sometimes a series does not hit its stride until later

No,no,no,no,no,no,no,no,no,no,no,no,no,no        Please don't waist your time!I would rather sit and watch paint dry than watch this BS This show had to be the worst show I've watched so far  Its EXTREMELY predictable!!!I Don't THINK THIS IS A SPOILER ALERT but I checked the damn box anyway I've watched 5 episodes  And in every episode they came face to face with the one person they were suppose to kill but for some reason or another they cant kill him!!! They don't try to capture him and hold him till they can kill him but they decide to let he get away and they'll just get him next time  GTFOH!!!!!Pure BS!!

This show had a lot of potential since it's release as it was the concept of bringing JUSTICE LEAGUE in the T V  The pilot was very interesting when we get introduced to the characters and RIP HUNTER tells them that they are not heroes,they are legends But,as soon as the show progressed it lost its momentum and the episodes started to be boring and dull The plot was getting repetitive and had nothing new to show the viewers{Except for the VFX}Luckily, this show was again back on its track from episode 9 as they addressed the real threat!PROS +Decent cast +Arthur Darvill's RIP +Purcell and Millers thrilling performance +VFX +A tragic end for Captain Cold +The establishment of JUSTICE SOCIETY in the finaleCONS -Was boring from episode 3 to 8-Hawkman/Hawkgirl story arc-Vandal Savage was not so terrifying Overall:It is a good show but it still has a lot of flaws  It's a must watch for those who are looking for extraordinary action on the small screen My Rating- 9/10

I was very excited about this show; I loved the preview trailer and made sure to watch the lead up episodes of The Flash and Arrow before the premiere A new show with some of my favourite characters from the DCTV Universe <U+0096> what could go wrong?EVERYTHING!I do have to congratulate Legends of Tomorrow on making probably one of my most hated characters from any movie or TV show I've ever watched!Rip Hunter is a d*ck; he lies, omits the truth, willing to sacrifice any and all of these characters at the drop of a hat, right up to the second to last episode, is a horrible leader and is so narrowly focused that it, more often than not, lead to mistakes and even worse, in some cases during the season, their mistakes would actually lead to teaching and helping the enemy Throughout the season it got to a point where the relationships on that ship was like a yoyo; one episode they're friends and the next they hate each other and will leave someone behind  One episode Person A and Person B will be the best of friends and then the next they are enemies  Now repeat this over and over Another thing that got repetitive over the season was the constant reminder that after every trip through time, the crew will suffer things like blindness, loss of hearing, vertigo and more but every time it happens everyone is 'Oh my god what's happening ' 'Oh yeah that's a result of jumping through time 'I found this hard to watch most of time, I would watch an episode a week and by the time the next came around, I wouldn't want to watch it but if I left it for two or three episode in a group, I like it even less The only highlights of this show is the costumes and set designs for the time periods but also Sara Lance and Martin Stein, who are always amazing in every episode  More often that not, Victor Garber would always steal the focus I did like how some characters grew, namely Mick/Heatwave, who was just the dumb muscle but has now been given a better storyline and character  On the flipside is Kendra Saunders/Hawkgirl, who started off with so much potential starting with her appearance on The Flash and the beginning of the show but when we got to the end, she had become kind of useless and one dimensional At the moment, I'm really torn whether I will be watching the second season

I tried it out but I stopped maybe 4 or 5 episodes before the finale  I just couldn't take it anymore  I understand that heroes have to make bad decisions for the sake of drama, and character development, and so the show will go on, but it's just stupid, unexplained decision after stupid, unexplained decision with this one  They keep making the same mistakes over and over and giving in to emotional plot holes even after the importance of keeping the mission in mind has already been established  At this point it even seems like they are literally making combat decisions for budget reasons  'We can't afford firestorm this week, so make sure those two get separated ' For me the last straw was SPOILER - The episode where they know where Vandal Savage lives in the 50's, and their plan is for Kendra to sneak in and stab him in the back  They've had at least 4 fights against this guy, they know that he knows that time travelers are hunting him, they know Kendra is no match for him, they know that Firestorm or Atom would be able to incapacitate him allowing Kendra to finish him off, but because Kendra has a tantrum when Atom tries to say it's a bad idea, the entire team gets behind what has to be the worst plan they've ever had and lose the one item that gave them a chance at completing their goal  The outcome was obvious and they tried to hide the fact that no one brought up a reasonable complaint with what I can only assume was supposed to be character development All in all, you might want to spare yourself the trouble and go watch Gotham or The Flash instead

Mindless, thoughtless waste of time  I'm not even sure if it can be classified as entertainment  It is Dumb with a capital ADHD  This not science fiction since there is ZERO logic or even a coherent flow idiocy  Who in a right mind will believe 12y/o kids were allowed to drink alcohol in USSR?! I can't find anything positive to say about this show and I've watched some horrible shows before  I'm bewildered how this awful thing got such high rating  Literally nothing good about it  It is awful  If you need to punish your children, make them watch this show  However I fear it might be classified as child abuse  Horrible, horrible show

Hey, you remember how fire actually burns stuff or ice guns you know, freeze things? Well, not here buddy  Captain Cold and Heatwave apparently got some magical guns that shoot fire and ice that just kinda shove people around  I mean, it's a level of suspended belief that I just can't go to This show emphasizes best the flaws of otherwise goods shows like Arrow and The Flash have combined  Pointless pathetic drama, over-enthusiastic camera work, nonsensical plots One thing it has going for it are already fleshed out and familiar characters combined with some good actors  Dynamics of the group is A-OK  That and you have to admire a little at least about what they're trying to do on TV  It's ambitious at least But then comes the plot, oh the plot  Paper thin plot that when you think about it even a little makes no damn sense and it's a mess from beginning to the end  Rip wants to do this and that, everybody says he can't, but the rules of time are whatever you want them to be, but they are actually not, or are they    and so on  For a Time Master, he should know a little bit better how time works and give at least some basic rules and not change them every damn time the plot writes itself into a corner  Which happens in almost every episode For a TV show that has time travel as one of the main plot points, Legends of Tomorrow really don't know how to use that and have fun with it  At least some semblance of logic and structure of the show would be nice  But as of now, plots and subplots and main themes almost always contradict themselves over some basic logic  That's probably best illustrated through Rip's plan which is    well it's a mess and I even don't know where to start  He wants to save his family and wants to kill Savage, but he can't, so they travel through time to do some convoluted things just because?! It's hard to explain  Most of the time when you watch this you ask  Huh, OK, but what's the plan here exactly again? What's going on and why?   They just do stuff and stuff just happens, there's no reason, no stakes, no depth  One other thing that drives me crazy, and it came from Arrow but on steroids, is overenthusiastic masturbatory camera work  Camera never stops, never  It always moves, pans doing some impossible shots  In process ruining fights, great dramatic scenes and makes everything look cheaper as well  Just chillax camera dude  Still shots and simple but smart moving shots can sometimes work wonders, we don't have to pan in through every warehouse dressed up as hangar/lair/abandoned warehouse/industrial plant/factory/sci-fi big room/core/place where they fight/etc  Leave the camera crane and dolly out sometimes, please  Because of it, fights look massively choreographed, devoid of any  punch  in them  Maybe season two will get better or maybe it'll get cancelled, who knows  As it stands now, this show needs some more direction and way tighter and coherent plot UPDATE SEASON 2: mostly the same mess as S1, some things got better - story arcs, characters, some worse - fire and ice still don't work like they should, plot writing itself into corner  And then there's the final episode of the season that is just infuriating - even in  Previously on Legends  part in this same episode they say something like  We can change time with a timeship, but not reality from the spear    And then they do just that, change reality with a timeship  WTF FFS FOLLOW YOUR OWN RULES, SHOW! Goddamit

5 is the vote, and not lower, only because it's clear that this project was meant to be important, because i think it's not a low budget, and then because i'm quite passionate about fantasy and sci-fi movies/series   the actor that plays  rip hunter  is a little meaningless, i don't what is the exact term in English,  in italy we say  insignificante    it means he has no appeal at all    in my honest opinion a simple switch, change, with Wentworth Miller as Rip Hunter and otherwise, would just have been easy and successfuldialogues, script, as other users said, are    i don't know how to say   childish, stupid purcell is not bad, maybe for the first time

Well I watch the series, as well as Arrow  Arrow season 1 is better than LoT, obviously  I hope season 2 may repair the rating  Well, Vandal Savage is known as not so fearful, due to his  ape and bearded appearance   However, Vandal's powers is not fire shooting, making rain or thunderbolts    he is a manipulator firstly, and then an immortal by thanks to the events of the past  Vandal first appeared as a weapon-merchant, later he will be a soviet supporter, dictator, mentor of the young Degaton  In the climax of the events, Vandal appeared as a nearly anti-hero, the Timemasters thinks that he can save Earth from the winged-aliens  (Thanachar, maybe   ) However, the Oculus which shows more than it previously mentioned is defeated by Rip Hunter and the crew in order to prevent the Time Masters to see their will  (logical, maybe) Future can be changed, one of the cliché-themed messages of the story  Raymond not died, but Snart maybe, in order to save Sara Lance and Mick  By tricking the events, Vandal is able to return 2166, where he kill Jonas and Miranda  Question: In the beginning, he walk off from that ship with Kendra? :D Time travel is always a risky thing  Rip Hunter: - Rip is a commoner, if I contrast him to Arrow, Quentin Lance or John Diggle, yet he is likable with his wits and his outbursts  He however should be more careful  His past story is interesting somehow, as how a thief become Time Master  (hooo    criminal became cop cliché?) The safe house with the young time masters also interesting, as was I surprised as child Rip Hunter (Michael) kills the Pilgrim  Woo    the hunters sent by the Time Masters before Pilgrim is a group of totally freaks  Atom is better than in Arrow season 3, he seems to be kind, brave, smart and cooperative  Firstly, I though he is related somehow Vandal Savage secretly, just thought what a great turn it is  Look: Well, Ray succeeds where Vandal not  If he already know about time travel, or he is just a little smart, he might travel back to tell past Vandal about his errors  He is however a psycho, so I do not know  Felicity is wrong, even her small cameo! Kendra is fair    however, I do not know about this relationship with Carter  I mean, it is destined to choose him always? Why? Because he is brave, has a fine jaw or sensible in a cliché level? Bring him back is disaster, he should remained dead, without him Kendra may kill Vandal with the mace or they just repeat the traveling to Egypt, where Vandal is an adolescent  But what if Vandal cloned himself? Many-many possible subplot  Carter - You have to remained to dead, for the betterment of the story, sorry  Snart - Most shrewd member, his theft jokes is always make me smile  However, he is compassionate, brave and selfless, he even show grace against Mick  Mick - The most interesting one, he is a dumb, aggressive enforcer by first sight  But he is a pyromaniac, low-cunning and headstrong man, his life as Kronos grows his cunning and will, he resist the torture second time, he is however wants to seem as a carefree and tough man, when he speaks with Ray at episode 15  I feel his rage unjust, when he talked with his younger self  (Violence makes you strong big cliché? Hope not   ) Sara Lance - Brave woman, and he is a desire to kill, but Kendra and Rip(if I well remember) helped her to calm down  She had a terrible past, Arrow seasons show it  Snart helps her to overthrow her killer attitude, they later crush on each other, as I saw  Firestorm - Professor is awesome, he is went through a considerable personality advance, as he became bolder and nicer  In the beginning he is arrogant, bossy and smart-ass, however he learns to listen Jackson, who is helpful, loyal, shrewd and heroic  Summary: I hope season 2 is better

I never imagined that a real person could portray Captain Cold until I saw Wentworth  Dominic Purcell was one of my favorites since John Doe but I have to say that Miller lends a great degree of authenticity to the role of Snart  He's a survivor and criminally motivated which adds a degree of diversity to the  super-hero  TV show  I hope Destiny is not his final performance because he makes me root for the bad guy and he is so important to the plot! When I first started watching the show my first question was  where is this going exactly  but now I see that there was care involved in making something new an innovative  It also doesn't hurt that Casper Crump is so close to looking and acting like Vandal Savage in the comics  They definitely put a lot of thought in this  I'll keep watching :)

Come on, I think you just don't have balls to create new enemy or new plot The Story just sooo bad and predictable I like Snart and Sara though Now the team, make up your mind, in some episode they have all the reason to beat Savage and save the world, in some episode they just vulnerable just like that, with only tiny problem  what do you really want? a good team with good teamwork or idiot team that don't really know what they are doing  Captain  That person is a captain? you has 14 episodes to make a good team and 14 episodes to know what your captain wants and what attitude that your captain has  Don't rush on story, catching or killing Savage, give us some glimpse of the team doing their best to synchronize each other, with good story telling  See Flash, See Gotham they are great There are much to do to make this TV series works, you guys can keep go on just because You are using the DC and The Flash name, other than that         sorry for my crappy English

Don't understand why the hate  I guess Olicity Soap Opera fans are not getting much out of it  Well its a journey of already build characters from Arrow & Flash  So if you are starting it without watching those or specially didn't watch Arrow then you might not connect with the characters well  Their journey start with single mission in mind & whole season is about how they face problems on the way to complete that mission  Really good quality CGI,good actions & Dialogues which are well written & enjoyable (not like arrow s3,4 where sometime you would like to pull out your hair cz how stupid characters sounds & act) As whole series is about Time travel on a ship with Earth's special 8 ,so don't expect too much of character or chemistry build up cause its not about chemistry with other travelers but more about completing Important mission  There are good amount of character struggle shown which was always enjoyableI think this show has perfect balance for martial art ,guns & super power hero & not struggling like Arrow with too many Archer ,martial artist side kicks  This shows also able to give each character its own unique fight skill which will not mix up with other I think those comic fans who are fed up with comic's, TV adaptation are becoming soap opera ,will find it enjoyable  I guess live action comic should look like this  Characters aren't too weak or struggling too much within to do the right thing ,instead its about how characters enjoy the journey in their missions knowing what is their purpose in the mission

Marvel and Comic book heroes, any program will be tempting to watch as was this and despite a disappointing first 3 episodes, the story line never seemed to hold up  Season 1 seemed to progress into an appalling Clichéd Love Drama overload with no improvements in the action or CGI to mitigate Culminating in a morale dilemma between taking a child's life to save  billions  with analogies of Rip Hunter's Family and a  Child Adolf Hitler   Absolute  WTF  moment when the plot screeched into a massive traffic pile-up despite killing  Innocent Adolf Hitler  is fine considering his destined future path but he catalyst to a supposedly even larger holocaust in exactly similar circumstance is more a  Child  than a future  World Tyrant   Hastily ending with a haphazardly strung ending meant to confuse and  Close Loose Ends  with a distracting following episode to distract just fizzled with a big  PFfffT   I personally feel struggling through 8 episodes was a total waste of time and overly generous faith and misplaced hope in the script writers getting better or at least putting in more effort and creativity A Discredit to DC Comics and the Characters whom still had some form of believable fantasy and credibility  Dragging  The Arrow  a terrible attempt to stay afloat was also uncalled  I am now much less keen to watch much less follow  The Arrow  Episodes  Better investment of  faith  in Marvel not mucking it up    yet

So much potential sent straight down the pot Plot: My 9 yo son could predict it if I allowed him to suffer through it Sci-Fi Nerd Plot Failures: Oh    this show is candyland for that  If you're looking for flaws, look no further  A fractal of Asimov dies each time someone gives this a good review Acting: Fair, but it's clear they're limited by the direction Whiz-Bang: Not a lotta eye candy, least not enough to make it worth watching unless you're a masochist I had such high hopes, but after suffering through the entire first season I feel like I should go whip myself  Honestly, I gave it a fair chance in hopes that it would blossom into something I'd like to sniff but the end result was akin to the aroma which surrounds a manhole cover The upside is that it is great to see anything semi Sci-Fi on one of the conglomerate networks, regardless of how vapid it is  Who knows, maybe someone who enjoys watching it might get turned onto the good stuff and provide viewers with some content that isn't so    hollow and consumer driven The downside is that if this series gets continued, when other excellent series haven't, my faith in general human intellect will drop yet another notch Time is something I have aplenty at the moment, and the only reason I gave this a 2/10 rating is because I broke my leg, had nothing else to watch, and it was better than watching the Smurfs  If stupid was edible, no one would be hungry  -Samuel Johnson

The sort of sad thing about this show is its relationship to Arrow and Flash  It really does have all the basic potential of those shows, but they seem to have forgotten to hire writers  The plots are all over the place, the characters are inconsistently stupid, despite all of them having backgrounds that belie that  If they could just knuckle down on the writing, create a consistent theme and some good episodes, it would work, but instead they have their characters doing inconsistently stupid acts, and they never seem to learn or develop Honestly, not the only series or film where this is a problem  Somehow the makers of entertainment have become worse and worse about throwing more and more money into making things look good, but no money into writing  Into creating characters and situations that we can believe in and care about  This show is just one good example especially because we can compare it with shows like Arrow and Flash, where part of the reason we watch is that there is enough reality to the fantasy for us to accept them  There is a lot of potential here, divergent characters who have each suffered in their own ways are brought together  People who are likely to contribute solutions to their problems based on unique experiences  And an incredible range of possibilities for plots, literally all of time  Anyone remember Firefly? Good writing is the foundation of making something like this work  This show does not have that at present

Apart from having near poor actors (except Captain Cold), the show lacks good writing and scripts  I understand that a you cannot expect complete sense from a science fiction and that too from a time traveling one  However what I don't understand is how come, if merely by not attaining a party can vanish the ring off professor Stein's finger, then doing all the fancy fighting in cowboy era doesn't set anything or affect anything in the future  The writers, in pure negligence/laziness or probably due to lack of understanding, are using all time travel and science mambo-jumbo to suite their needs which are contradictory and making no sense even from the standards of fiction  Certain mistakes like  prince Khufu  being called  carter  and  Chay- Ara  being called  Kendra  across different incarnations is the proof lazy writing I never had any expectations from this one but this might have spoiled the entire Flash/Arrow world for me  I hope however that they don'g bring back the dead Canary in the Arrow now

I don't even know where to start with this one  I want to like it, I really want to like it  Greg Berlanti usually does pretty interesting stuff, but this particular series just seems to be so lackluster and largely pointless I also want to like it because of Brandon Routh and Victor Garber who, again, have both been good in other things  I think the writing is to blame  Hackneyed, cliché, and clunky, never mind that some of the plot is just ridiculous    Yuck    Watching it as I write this, but I have to change the channel to something different, it's just too stupid to continue watching

UPDATE: I've continued watching this for the second season and it's gone downhill as far as the writing goes  The plots are getting thinner and the characters have become cardboard cutouts  Dominic Purcell is still pulling off some amazing scenes considering how poorly his character is being written but other good actors like Victor Garber are flailing with the dismal dialogue  I'm downgrading it from a 7 to a 6 First Season; This is wonderfully over-dramatic and insanely convoluted with gaps in logic and reason  It's a comic book come-to-life  If you've tuned in for award-winning acting and realism, you're not finding it here and you're kind of crazy for thinking you would For me, it's fun, energetic and full of inside geek jokes  It's also a bit heavy-handed with the 'redemption/friendship' themes but this is pretty standard in superhero stuff If you follow Arrow or Flash, this is going to feel very familiar  Many of the characters were introduced on those shows and the productions are all filmed in Vancouver so they have a similar vibe to them My only real complaint about the show is that the 'captain' isn't particularly likable  It feels like they've tried to cross Dr  Who with Indiana Jones but he can't quite pull it off Marvel Comics has set the bar very high with Joss Weadon at the helm and this doesn't compete on the same level but it's still entertaining

I'm still not sure how I feel about  Legends of Tomorrow   I liked Ray more in  Arrow  and the thought of these eight random rogues working together is baffling  But the more I watched the more I learned to accept the show for what it is: comic book eye candy  That's really all it is  There's occasional moments of good acting; they're rare but they happen, mainly from Garber and Miller who fit like a glove into their characters Dr  Martin Stein and Leonard Snart (Captain Cold) respectively  None of the acting is offensively bad actually  It's the writing that's the bane of the show  These characters are constantly saying and doing the stupidest possible things in any given situation  It's one thing to suspend disbelief but it helps to have a modicum of common sense to keep us grounded, which many of these characters do not The writers clearly don't care  The concept of time is asinine  They go back and forth through time with no coherent explanation, reasoning, or consequence  Vandal Savage is wasted as a villain  Casper Crump plays him as an over-the-top Christoph Waltz type baddie, and he's fun to watch but the character itself is hollow and awfully written into the show  Every confrontation between the Legends and Savage end up with Savage escaping in an inexplicably dumb fashion, and then the group continues their search to attack him in a different time  Characters say things that make you upset at the TV, like,  Did you really have to do that? Now I have to dislike you  The plot itself is ass  Rip Hunter gathers a team to find and kill Vandal Savage by attacking him at different points in time  But it's like, who cares? You can accept it because it's so confident in its insanity and so insistent on constantly shoving money at the screen to distract us, and for the most part, it works  The first few episodes are tough to stomach because the writing is SO gratingly awful from the get-go, but once the characters develop more and gain some semblance of chemistry (between some of them at least, namely Snart and Sara) and when they experiment with different time periods, that's where the show starts to get fun  The Wild West episode is entertaining, as are the ones where they explore the '50s and the racism and sexism that come with it  And the characters do grow on you  Snart was carrying the first few episodes but now it's more balanced  It's difficult juggling so many main characters and the show suffers for it, but the fun comes from watching these misfits interact in their absurd surroundings, making for some fun character building moments and the occasional comic relief  I actually don't hate Sara anymore, and Mick does his best Batman impression which makes for some hilarious moments, intentional or otherwise As it stands,  Legends of Tomorrow  has a lot of potential  Clearly the special effects budget is satisfied - the action sequences are fun to watch - but the writing needs to come together if this is going to continue as a series longterm  If nothing else, it's better than  Arrow  this season (though that's not saying much)  If you're a fan of the other DC shows or a sci-fi nut in general, you might get some popcorn-level entertainment from  Legends of Tomorrow

Here we go again! Why is it that most TV writers, when doing a show based 100% on the idea of time travel, totally ignore the implications of the paradox they create? In this show we have a man hell bent on going back in time to kill the person responsible for killing his wife and son; of course, he also wants to  save the world , but that's just icing on the cake for him  That is the total reason why he defies the Time Masters, steals a time ship and assembles a crew for the mission Now lets say he is ultimately successful and kills this guy  Now his wife and son no longer get murdered  Wait! If his wife and son are not murdered, he no longer has a reason to defy the Time Masters, steal a time ship and assemble a crew for the mission! So it never happens! This is the most basic paradox there is for any story based on time travel  It's the same as the Grandfather Paradox  It you were to go back in time and kill your grandfather when he was a young man, before your father is born, you would never be born and thus could not go back in time to murder your grandfather! Good time travel stories get around this paradox by proposing the idea of creating alternate timelines  But such a theory has not been done here Too bad!

The concept of this series was very promising  Use a time machine to stop an immortal threat from eventually taking over and ending the world  I just wish they had watched a time machine show or movie before trying to write this show  The  leader  of the mission Rip Hunter is by far the worst, incompetent, time traveler ever put on TV  **Spoiler**In the second episode he says it is impossible to change the past in which they participated in or it will cause a temporal paradox  Which is normal time travel knowledge  In  Time Cop  interacting with yourself would remove yourself from the timeline as an example  In the very last episode of this show I will ever watch has him allowing themselves to save themselves in the past (White Canary)  Then Rip tells his team they cant interact with themselves (after it has already been done), but ends with him patting his younger self on the shoulder telling him he will be OK right before his younger self stabs the villain and is immediately put into the line of fire of all their attacks  Who thought that was a good plan? This is after the  heroes  who had previously just abducted newborn baby versions of themselves from their parents (they literally take one of them from their fathers arms right after they were born leaving the heroes mother bleeding in the backseat of their car)  Which sounds horribly non heroic to me  Why not capture the villain who is trying to kill all of the cast when they were young, when they saved themselves earlier? Atom hits the villain with a blast and then just leaves  WHY NOT CAPTURE HER THEN? Then later they complain that they cant find where she is and they are all in danger  It makes me wanna slap the writers  At first I thought it was cause they were  heroes  and didn't want to kill the villain  But at least try to capture her to protect yourselves  Its like Rip told them all before the mission, to only save themselves and let the problem with the time travelling villain to escalate for no reason  But no they put them in a safe house which changes the future so that their loved ones no longer recognize them, but then kill the villain anyways  Breaking the laws of time, and maybe directly changing themselves and their pasts to the point where they most likely wont have gotten aboard the time ship in the first place after leading completely different lives   There are numerous times when the heroes could have ended the show by removing the immortal villain Vandal Savage, but choose to run away instead  I mean he is literally knocked out and Kendra the only one who can end him forever is nearby with the knife needed to save everyone just leaves for no reason  (She was hurt at the time but just carry her over to him and end him   ) ** Spoiler end**While the special effects are good, the writing of the show is so mind blowingly horrible it is not worth admission  Its like watching a horrible horror movie where the victims randomly drop useful weapons and walk around alone for no reason, after so many stupid decisions, it makes you want them to die for their stupidity  The only reason this show has not gotten a 1 rating for me is the decent special effects  In my opinion, this show should be put out of its mercy and the writers should never work in Hollywood again

In my opinion, Legends of Tomorrow is a series that built up hype but was a let-down  There is little to no character development in this series  It has an unfocused storyline and boring characters  The only likable characters were Captain Cold, Rip Hunter and The Atom  One of the few good things of this series is showing the hopeful future for the Arrowverse  There are a few episodes that are enjoyable such as the Jonah Hex episode and the Star City 2046 episode  A majority of the acting is bland and one- dimensional  There is more campy jokes and set-up for potential spin-offs than storyline  I really hope that the second season is much more of an improvement because so far, Legends of Tomorrow is a mess of a series with a sloppy storyline and one-dimensional characters  I don't recommend it unless you like unfocused narrative and cheesy one- liners  4/10

It was a nice start for this series with a bunch of heroes and a time traveler going up against Vandal Savage  But then very fast it became less about Vandal and more about time travel  Now it has become a very bad depiction of  doctor who   they just go somewhere in time, messes up the time line and then try to fix it but most of the time they mess it up beyond repair  Besides time travel is such a delicate subject and they don't seem to care enough, according to the lead role, Rip hunter, as long as he is doing something to prevent Savage's uprising he is doing right no matter the consequences  Then there is that forced love story of Atom and HawkGirl, just pathetic  Don't understand how Captain cold and Mick fit into this, they always have their own agenda  For a person so concerned about Savage how can he risk the time line with those 2 doing their own thing  Finally you see Vandal in 1 out of 5 episodes, rest are just ridiculous and unnecessary time travels  I had enough of this, good luck to those who are still waiting for something good to happen

It started out as a good idea  Vandal Savage is a brilliant villain in the DC comics and would be excellent as the antagonist  However the acting is terrible and the script has been written by teenagers 1  Hawkgirl is supposed to be a battle hungry warrior but this hawkgirl has serious identity issues and a terrible costume 2  Once again Brandon Routh has ruined another DC hero  He is a terrible atom, although better than him in Superman returns 3 Sara Lance aka white canary is probably the most entertaining one of them all  But she is an ASSASSIN yet she doesn't kill  Seriously DC?4  Captain Cold is supposed to be Mr  Freeze's sidekick  Plus the way he talks annoys me 5  The 2 people who make up Firestorm are always fighting over the same thing and it's really getting on my nerves 6  Rip Hunter is a terrible leader, tactician and pilot  Not to mention his gun from the future looks horrible  I'd have respected him more if they used a much more suave actor who uses an actual  44 magnum

Be wary of this show   it is NOT the same quality as the Flash, or even Arrow  I have a few main gripes with this show, not the least of which is the story  Time travel is never an easy concept to grasp for fantasy, but this show ABSOLUTELY BUTCHES IT'S OWN RULES  They say that they can't go back and mess with time, BUT LITERALLY EVERY SHOW IS MESSING WITH TIME  It almost never has any ramifications that stick  Butterfly effect? Not a thing, in the least  Beyond that, things just happen without much explanation and it feels at the very least unnatural  Mick and Leonard fight and then are somehow okay with each other for no reason  Kendra loves Ray because   reasons  It's all slopped together, and not in the least cohesive  The dialogue is also very corny  it seems as though they try to put in humor, but the writers suck and not once has it made me laugh  As far as the action goes, it's OKAY but nothing too special  It doesn't really ever feel intense, and in no way does it ever keep me on the edge of my seat  Also, there's a lot of times where the characters decide not to use their powers, which is just great  Ever wanted to see Martin Stein use a gun instead of being Firestorm a lot of the time? This show is for you  I have a lot more complaints, but it can be summed up as, at the very least, disappointing  Especially when you have an awesome main series, in  The Flash   That show does everything right  You care about the characters, the action is awesome, the storyline is engaging, good stuff  Not this

Actually i think its not bad   I watched first 2 episodes and it was nice  Cast is good, i think only 2 guys are new other ones are appearing in other movies and series whit the same role and they are almost as the guys in comics   If you ask me its quite refreshing to see them together saving the world   don't trust everyone, watch it and then decide if you like it or not   i almost regret it   stay frost (:

There is actually no logic in this series, despite that it consists of bad acting, high paced but in the end meaningless action sequences, characters, who are not really interesting (despite snart and sometimes firestorm) and a lot of vfx  VFX doesn't make a bad script good  Sometimes the show manages to be slightly entertaining, but in the end, it's not even good entertainmentThe character of kendra also just doesn't work, she is boring and you don't really care what happens to her though she seems to be the core to the story  The flash is way better!The worst part is still the script!I hope it will get better in future episodes, but I'll probably won't be watching
