I can let the numerous loopholes go seeing as there are so DAMN MANY OF THEM   I can even forgive the idiotic narrative Even the fact that the whole series should've been over in episode 1, instead we get the old  bad guy tells his plans and foils himself  spiel The acting is shocking It is incredibly repetitive and is just Arrow rehashed without any comedic value or interest  You'd think with time travel they'd have better ideas than these The time travel makes it incredibly convoluted  This show is truly horrible compared to others like the Flash, Arrow, hell even Supergirl is better

All fair and square it gets a 2 for me for having real actors and okayish FX  The rest is just     borderline insulting  1)Most of the plot involve the  legends  not listening to one another and fighting among themselves  2)The science is--- argh  You would expect some thought actually given to time travel as it is quite the tricky subject, but no  It's just a patchwork of ideas with no logic behind them  Examples (spoilers),in one episode they travel to a future which is all messed up and decide to fix things there before going back to the past - which renders pretty much this episode useless  Ship is affected by gravity while traveling through time? meh There is supposed to be this time master guild thing, they show up with updated time master tech  Wouldn't just traveling in the future in the first place would have enabled the guild to have whatever tech they might have needed from the get go?Time pirates ?3)The antagonist is an immortal; nothing is clearly done to stop him  IT is more a search for him, fighting, messing up time line, going back into ship, inner discord, repeat To sum up  Quite a fail  I play the episode as bckrg noises to keep my cats busy when there is nothing else

The pilot episode sets forth the promising tale of a motley crew destined for greatness on a romp through time and space  And, for the most part, it succeeds at continuing a trend of mostly-good DC Superhero TV on the CW  Helped along by several characters that have earned us caring about them from their development on Arrow and The Flash, Victor Garber's Martin Stein, Caity Lotz's Sarah Lance, and Brandon Routh's Ray Palmer ground the show with enough heart to kick-start it into action Meanwhile, Snart and Rory continue to play the well characterized pair of funny anti-heroes that we have seen again and again on the other CW shows  In particular, Captain Cold's absurdly dry sense of humor and knack for puns cuts through moments of necessary pilot exposition The real standout, though, is Arthur Darvill as Rip Hunter, whose sharp comedic timing and deeper acting chops should help keep the show grounded in a strong protagonist moving forward  The more Legends of Tomorrow leans on Darvill and Garber for dramatic story lines, the better Unfortunately, not all of the characters on the team are well-developed or well-acted  Hawkman and Hawkgirl continue to be as trite and uninteresting as they were during their stint on The Flash  And despite the potential in Vandal Savage as a character, his writing thus far has not been nuanced or compelling enough to set him on par with CW's other seasonal  Big Bads  Moving forward, the show should succeed if it focuses on its characters and actors that elevate it above mere comic book cheese, and if it executes its promise of time-travel shenanigans in inventive, fun ways Legends of Tomorrow doesn't look poised to knock The Flash from its  best in DC  throne just yet  The Flash benefits from not having boring main characters (I'm looking at you Hawkman/Hawkgirl, and Arrow's terrible Laurel Lance)  Consistency will be Legends of Tomorrow's biggest challenge if it wants to one-up The Flash and legitimize future expansion of CW's DC Universe  6/10

Almost every movie with time travel in it have problems with the consistency and logic  If you want a whole series with the worst kind of logical mishaps around time travel - this is the show for you!Finally they beat the bad guy after a few episodes, but he is immortal, so they just leave him (although they have won and don't need to rush) to resurrect, and immediately looks for the next place in time where they can find him  Why!?? Just take the body and put him in jail if you cannot kill him definitely! They have all the possibilities right there! All the other actions the characters take are so flawed and retarded I cannot stand it  The possibilities they have with time travel are endless, and yet all the time they take some really random course of action with no sense to it The acting, visual effects, characters etc is really good  But the story is so flawed I have to let go

its BRADON ROUTH made me watch the show its only him and only him only because i cant off my eyes of him   HE IS SIMPLY PERFECT   His appeal is like a magnet on TV  As fun as the other DC comics have been to this point, the action sequences have operated on a small scale, Seemingly taking on a philosophy of fight or die the action is not only pure spectacle, but perfectly fast paced , who makes frequent cuts so that we can see everything that's going on with the different heroes  The battle sequence between the superhero team bad guys army is better than all of the action in the other TV action super heroes combined and multiplied by ten  It earns the buildup from all the preceding films by being the most epic title we've seen with these characters yet

This show focuses on the stupidity and pettiness of each superhero rather than the action aspect the audience expects from a super hero series  Personalities have been over-exaggerated and in some cases completely contradicts the part they played in Arrow and Flash  Events from the show are unrealistic well beyond its sci-fi component Thus far the show has no characters to catch your eye  There is a reason to dislike every character in the show and there has been no character/team development  The plot is messy where every character has their own agenda  Advice to the directors is to return to what a super hero show should focus on - the discovery of powers and learning to control such powers  There's no reason Hawk Girl should still be merely a human with wings and no other abilities  Tie the team together already with a strong leader  The learning curve to work as a team should've passed long ago yet there's been no progress on collaboration  It's almost like watching a pathetic drama at this point In Arrow and the Flash, it takes at least half a season to get to reach the criminal mastermind  In this show, it takes half an episode every time The 3 points I gave go towards the visual effects and the fact that Arrow and The Flash are tied in well to this show

Like most i am sure i waited with anticipation for this  Already being a big fan of arrow and flash my expectations were high  Disappointed would be too strong a statement but it really needs pulling together  It will always be difficult to make things gel when you have several superheroes all vying for the same position but Flash and Agents of shield make it work  There are lots of things which make me cringe  TIME MASTER  come on guys even though Arthur Darvill previously DOCTOR WHO doesn't warrant the tag  TIME LORD  (Not sure he is a strong enough character) The only characters holding it together are Caity Lotz BLACK CANARY and Wentworth Miller CAPTAIN COLD  Writers need to rethink the whole plots and subplots if season two is going to be a success  Just take a look around at FLASH and Agents of Shield don't try to reinvent the wheel when it already turns

Captain cold,Heat wave, Firestorm , Atom ,White canary , Rip hunter , Hawk-man,Hawk-girl's most important adventure from stopping Vandal Savage from being the dictator of the world by changing the time line (actually one of the best ideas ever) Went worth Miller has performed quite well There are many suspense s and Twists as they time travel  Time travel is an imaginary idea   But legends of tomorrow has made us believe that time traveling real   My preference is Captain cold since he is COOL  The team selection is good -Dr Martin Stein(BRAIN),Captain Cold(STEALTH),heat wave (MUSCLE),Atom (SHRINK),White canary (FIGHTING SKILLS),Hawk girl and Hawk man (TEAM SPIRIT) The start is good the TV series is fast and not slow  One of the BEST TV SERIES EVER

As a lover of the flash and arrow I was really looking forward to this  A Justice League type TV show is just what DC needs after the success of Flash and Arrow, but I'm still not impressed All of the characters have different personalities and a variety of powers, but so far I just don't see them working together  There doesn't appear to be any coordination or team work  In fight scenes its just everyone doing their own thing near each other  Outside of fighting they all get tasked to do something and most of the time end up ignoring orders to do what they want The acting and effects are good  I even like most of the heroes, but the writers really messed up this show  I understand a certain amount of character building is needed for a show like this, but 8 episodes in and there's still no teamwork, no storyline advances and so far only 1 good episode(7)

The idea of scooping up a number of fringe heroes and villains into one in-fighting unit might work in comic-land but certainly doesn't seem to on the TV screen  Here we get a motley selection of characters from DC's two hit series  The Flash  and  Arrow , pressed into action to chase down time-travelling super-villain Vandal Savage under the aegis of their self-appointed, very British team-leader Rip Hunter I'm not aware of this show being based on any original magazine in the DC universe, making this a new-for-TV premise and I have to say it looks and plays awkwardly  Arthur Darvill steals some clothes from another time traveller with whom he's previously shared a police box and adds the most pukka English accent he can find  As for his assorted companions, they seem too many and too disparate  I get that they're mostly in pairs, Hawkman and Hawkgirl, ex-cons Captain Cold and Heat Wave and of course the two-for-the-price-of-one Firestorm making me think that Ray Atom Palmer and Sara Canary might yet get together  For me, they all of them just don't really gel, lines apparently distributed to each just to give them something to say rather than delineating character I must say, I'm also finding the endless deaths of the hawk-pair are starting to bore too and still haven't quite worked out what makes Vandal Savage so omnipotent and a match for all of them  The SFX aren't doing it for me either especially those involving Hawkman, Hawkgirl and The Atom  The idea of chasing Savage through time is of course unoriginal but could work if used imaginatively and humorously enough but this might take time (no pun intended) to fully develop Whether the programme finds an audience and gets retained for another series will be interesting to see  Personally, I'm not optimistic and really much prefer the characters where they were before  Maybe it'll get deeper and darker as it goes but just now I'm not really sure it's going anywhere but into TV oblivion

Having just watched ep 8 it's hard to see where this show is going  Vandal Savage is not a strong villain and the plot is wandering all over the place and the romantic sub plots!Chronos is almost a joke and to my mind the team have not really bonded or become interesting  The characters on Flash and Arrow are likable and the plots seem to have a point and a destination  Special effects are very average, read cheap  Dressing up in 1950's dresses is not the same as making us feel like they are real time travellers  They won't make season 2 unless the episodes really improve

I've been looking forward to this show since that last ep of Flash  The trailer looked good and I was excited  Unfortunately all the talent must have gone into creating the trailers and marketing the show, because the actual product    well it really blows  What a disappointment I gave it a try too, watched all the episodes hoping the writers will find their footing eventually, but I guess not  Here are what sucks about the show:- Rip Hunter -- I think the actor is all wrong for the part, he has no chemistry with anyone and he's supposed to lead the team!!! So far he seems to be in the way and an annoyance more than anything  His clichéd storyline of avenging the deaths of his wife and son (ugh) already bored me to tears  With so many good and unpredictable shows around (e g Shades of Blue), you CANNOT be this boring and clichéd - The two (now one) winged people -- again these were the most dreary actors acting the dreariest of parts  They were so depressing, neither one looked like they wanted to be there  They were made tolerable in The Flash despite their individual awfulness, I think the writers on Flash really deserves praise for that - Captain Cold and Heatwave -- the two best actors on the show made up some of the least horrible scenes that were at least mildly entertaining, but barely scratched their acting skills  Why waren't they used more?? - Canary -- not used nearly enough, again a talent that is wasted by poor writing- Firestorm duo -- again, they were great in the Flash  But somehow on this show, they just don't pop  Even scenes that are supposed to be touching or meaningful end up flat or are spoiled by the pace of the show - The Atom -- he was good in Arrow and the Flash buit in legends of Tomorrow, this poor guy comes across as a very flat 2-dimensional character  He's used mostly for (weak) jokes and laughs In short, after watching and giving up on Legends of Tomorrow, I have a newfound appreciation for the shows that are actually GOOD and the writers that produce those awesome shows

I want to really like this show but every episode seems to be the same  With all the advantages of coming from the future they cannot seem to stop one guy from ancient Egyptian times  Each mission seems to be the same, the Snark brothers seem to want to go off script and rob a bank, the priestess is not confident in her skills, Sara has blood-lust etc   You really cannot capture or kill a guy when you have technology 50-100 years(or 1000's of years if you go back to his birth) newer this guy would never see coming? I mean I understand he's somewhat immortal but snatch the guy, pull a Han Solo and freeze/bury him and dump him in the deepest part of the ocean I'm hoping it gets better because I do enjoy the Flash and Arrow for some mindless entertainment  Giving it a couple more episodes

I'm definitely a Marvel guy and the DC Comics TV Shows are no help to the argument  So if you're a fan of Arrow, Supergirl or The Flash, this review does not apply to you  The acting is mediocre (I mean, even when they're just shooting their guns with no lines whatsoever, they're unconvincing),the props look like cheap toys, the sets are way too fake, they can't even nail simple explosion scenes! The dialogs are beyond predictable and emotional in all the wrong places  I get that the  Prison Break bros  are supposed to portray two psycho villains but do they have to make the crazy eyes and creepy faces? Constantly reminding us how evil and devious criminals they are    We get it, we get it! You're two crazy dudes  Get over it  I find it impossible to relate to any of these characters because they have no personality, they just look like people who watched one too many Steven Seagal movie by the way they walk and talk  Or, it's possible that my expectations were way too high due to the (misleading?) 7 5 stars on IMDb  I don't get it  Can't help but imagine a roomful of guys in a DC-owned building just giving fake ratings  I would recommend Jessica Jones and Daredevil  Or just watching your nails grow

This show could be soooo much cooler  I think the developers were trying to go for an  American  Dr  Who  They even hired Arthur Darvil to play  Rip Hunter  (manly name for a wimpy guy) to play the Capt  of the time ship  The time ship is bigger on the inside than the outside though it does not look like a police box  The Doct    I mean the Captain's companions are a group of reject heroes and anti heroes that decide to go with the Capt  to save the world from Vandal Savage, an immortal  Where does the show fail  Acting is okay with a few of the actors but gets overshadowed by some of the poorer actors that they play next too  With time as each gets used to playing their character that may improve  The plots  Oh those terrible, contrived, poorly thought out plots  The way the characters are forced to  solve  the problems that face them is almost cringe worthy  I find myself saying,  wait, this is stupid why don't they just      Forced plots are no fun to sit through and are the results of lazy writers not being able to match the abilities of the characters with the problems that they face  Thus plot holes and characters ignoring the obvious abound in the series  With Scooby Doo I can understand why they are always splitting up to go find the ghost, but when this happens all the time in this series causing all sorts of problems that could have easily been avoided, it grates  Finally the writing and character relationships  Why the crew has not thrown the Captain out an airlock is beyond me  Some of the relationships seem almost as forced as the plots  The dialog needs more cleverness and wit  Perhaps if they could track down some of the writers for Doctor Who we could see a positive change

OK, why the heck doesn't Firestorm actually get used? The NUCLEAR MAN is always in his two component entities, each swinging ineffectual punches at things  SERIOUSLY!? The episode 'Marooned' had both Stein and Jefferson surrounded by bad guys, AND THEY DIDN'T EVEN CONSIDER BONDING INTO FIRESTORM He's the most powerful member of the team, and yet   they'd rather have White Canary kick things and get tossed across the room This show should be canceled  It's really hard to find a reason to like it  It's a crying shame, because Arrow and The Flash are actually pretty good shows, but this one reeks of another DC dropped ball :(

I read in the IMDb page for this TV series and it provide a discussion about Rip Hunter and Dr  Who and how much they kind of resembled each other, which I did catch in the first two episodes that I watched  So, who stole who's idea or which came first Dr  Who or Rip Hunter? Just curious  But regardless the show was very good so far and I look forward to watching more episodes  I hope there is someway that the two characters that are hawks are reunited again  In their realm I guess anything is possible  Lets hope that this isn't a flash in the pan and after this season, the studios cancel it like other shows of late  Marvel, keep up the great work like Marvels Agent Carter and others that you have put out for our enjoyment

A bunch of super heroes, time jumps, how can you go wrong? Well, apparently, quite a lot  The script is not inspiring and quite repetitive, the acting is not exactly Oscar material, the subplots and budget bickering (having actors bicker about nonsense is very cheap, that's what Walking Dead taught us) are starting to get aggravating I've watched six episodes now and I don't think this show is worth my time  I don't think I like a single one of the main characters, they all feel very shallow and cheesy The only reason I continued watching was it was a sci-fi show, but love for a genre cannot save a mediocre show

I started watching this based on the high score it had initially on IMDb (about 8 6 two weeks ago) and I was seriously disappointed  The only explanation I have for the unusual high score for a new show is that the producers pay lots and lots of people to write positive reviews in order to get a high score that would attract lots of people (like me)  What is the point though, if after watching the first episode the normal viewer (like me) will be disappointed enough to stop watching the show and even come to IMDb to make things right and write the truth about it  There isn't really much to say but that they decided to pick the most clueless of  super heroes  from other shows and start one  I don't know which one is worse  The white (or black or grey) canary is a terrible actress and her skills in martial arts are to say the least ridiculous for someone so chubby and out of form, the dress she is wearing now (grey) is so tight around her rack that a very unlovable piece of fat pops from under her arms    NOT NICE TO WATCH  The two former prison break actors are as bad, perhaps they'd do better trying to break from some jail again  The others I can barely remember  The plot is about some time/space traveling trying to catch  the worst criminal ever  and failing miserably in each attempt  The fighting scenes are just plain silly with prison break brothers firing some kind of flame thrower that hurts no one and grey canary hitting people with two sticks  I have stopped watching this after the second episode

I am neither qualified enough nor can i say enough about how exhilarating and mesmerizing this series is What i can say is that i am both a fan and an enthusiast of modern cinematic showcases and like most have grown up with an appreciation for television series often secretly proclaiming to be somewhat of a connoisseur  I gave this show a try and continually wished for it to be what i hoped and chose not to watch it for fear of it not meeting my expectations  I was pleasantly surprised In our culture not enough praise is given to our entertainment and for some reason a collective have taken it upon themselves to find faults and ridicule rather than every purposefully beautiful, engineered detail in what we are presented - this i feel is not the right approach and i always try to find the best in everything Legends of tomorrow delivers  For me it is an unbelievable culmination of brilliantly executed meta-neo-fantasy  The actors, the graphics, the staging, the design - all beaming in an array of synchronosis i have never seen before  There is wit, there is drama and unwavering action which i cannot explain where the makers have found the time to choreograph  In short a bravo of extended gratitude - i am glad to be in this time, (to fit along with the premise) privileged to witness this perfect piece of spectacular spectacle

Personally I really enjoy this series  Is it a hardcore DC/marvel series? No  And it's not supposed to be  Is it an in depth story with big names and script? Nope  But that's not a bad thing really  It's just a fun series that has interesting characters with different pasts who want to become legends for different reasons and in the process grow as a character  If your looking for a 100% DC then your looking at the wrong series, but if you just wanna watch a series that is inspired by characters of DC on a fun spin off that doesn't take itself to seriously then it's worth the watch  I actually prefer this series to the flash by far, and the Arrow as well (first few seasons of the Arrow was good, then it just got weird)  It's a great series that I truly enjoy watching and eagerly wait for the next episode!

This show is idiotic  I don't know who writes it   a bunch of 12 year old kids with below average IQ? Acting sucks   it's as if there is no director at all   No redeeming qualities  I wish there was only the Flash and Arrow at this point  Supergirl and this crap ruins the universe Had to stop watching after episode 3  HAD TO  I hated all 3 episodes, pretty much every single aspect of them  Made me hate characters I previously liked or loved  I absolutely loved Sarah in the Arrow, and I liked the professor when he first showed up  BAH, don't even know what to say  The show makes no sense at all, logic is not something the writers have  I'm hoping that there will be no crossovers between this and the Flash and Arrow

Here's the thing about Legends of Tomorrow: if you've been watching Arrow and The Flash and Supergirl right along, then you already know the level of writing and style of acting that you're going to meet in Legends of Tomorrow  Let's be honest, it's not the best writing in the world and the acting is (I think rather purposely) over-the-top  In that sense it's actually rather true to the comics, where there is a great deal of declaring  I will defeat you!  before clashing weapons  If you are looking for superhero-realism, go watch something Marvel  The DC televised universe has steered clear of realism ever since Barry Allen walked onto the set of Arrow  If you can't stand to watch the other DC shows, then don't bother watching this one as it is set in the exact same tone and style If, however, you can enjoy the comic-book style fun of The Flash and Supergirl, and you've been sitting around wondering where the heck Snart and Ray Palmer and Prof  Stein have gone off to, then Legends of Tomorrow is for you! It's a bumpy start, and after the pilot episode I'm still wondering why exactly Captain Cold and Heatwave are bothering to hang around, but then Supergirl had a rough start too and she's managed to pull things together enjoyably The biggest adjustment: Arthur Darvill (aka Rory Williams) is now playing a rather Doctor-like character, Rip Hunter  A man from the future, he stole a time machine against the orders of the Time Masters, and is now traveling around with a band of misfits trying to save the world  Insert skeptical face here  A quick visit to Wikipedia reveals that Rip Hunter is a character that's been around since the '70's in various incarnations, and that the writers handpicked the choicest details, scrambled them together, and have now invented for our pleasure a new version of the character (nothing new there)  If the character is examined it's not really the Doctor at all  A little less staggering intelligence, a little more bad-assery, and a deep seeded need for vengeance that drives everything he does, and the character of Rip looks less and less like the Doctor  It'll be interesting to see how he develops, along with all these other characters The most correct comparison for LoT would be to the Justice League, but as everyone is determined to compare it to Marvel then the best comparison is Agents of Shield meets Guardians of the Galaxy; A ragged team of misfits that don't really know what they're doing yet in a very mission-based, weekly plot  It's not the best thing to hit television, but it's far from the worst  And like all CW shows, it's not the plot that brings me back each week but the characters  Concern and curiosity for them will allow me to give this show a chance  And if you take my advice, you'll give it a chance too

This show is a stain upon an otherwise unremarkable universe  It is a weak attempt to preempt Marvel's 'The Defenders' in creating a team-based superhero TV series, but fails miserably from the very start  What stands out is the mediocrity of the cast, the horrendous acting, the nonsensical and inconsistent premise (at the pilot, that must be a record!), and the motivation for the entire show literally being  forbidden love gone 'I told you so'  with time shenanigans Rip Hunter is a time-traveler who had a very brief mention as the inventor of the 'time bubble' in 'The Flash'  He wields a laser revolver  It is seriously designed to look like a revolver, with a cylinder having blue light where the bullet chambers would normally be  He is the sole reason the team exist, and his motivation is boring, unoriginal, and lacking  For a character with the ability to travel through time, he always seems to be in a hurry  His ship is called the 'Waverider', which is a reference to another DC character (who is not, in fact, a time traveling spaceship)  The series starts with him pleading to his employers to let him save the world, with a more than obvious conclusion the series expects to be a major reveal at the end of the pilot  It's not The team-selection process reveals strong self-awareness, as the primary reason for why Rip selects this team is quite literally  no one cares about you guys and you will have no significant impact on the DC extended universe   I wish I was making this up, but this is what goes for creative writing nowadays  Now, we not only have a show with mediocre characters played by mediocre actors in a mediocre story, we're also told from the very get go that these characters are insignificant and a bunch of losers The first recruit is Atom, a guy with a special suit allowing him to shrink (and fly and shoot lasers because screw comics)  The original comic version has a belt giving him powers, but nowadays full-body power suits with horrendous rotating parts (really, designer?) are popular  Character looks like a firefighter in midlife crisis with the power of technobabble and being insignificant in more ways than just being small Next up is Firestorm, an otherwise interesting character made uninteresting due to his generic origin and exposition in 'The Flash'  The main theme for Firestorm seems to be to make sure he rarely gets the opportunity to 'combine' in order to cut costs on CGI  Two combat encounters in the pilot alone had the professor and the mechanic kid split up, giving the reason  we don't need your blast-y powers , which stands for  our budget is only sufficient to have you on screen for no more than a couple seconds  Keeping with the theme of low budget, the White Canary is a misrepresented rehash of her 2010 comic version, where the character starred in 6 issues before being put to an early grave  She is a cheap replacement for the Black Canary who had the good sense of not participating in this abortion of a show  Thus, color-inverted canary was designed around the very concept of cheap, giving her a white jumpsuit and two iron bars  Couldn't afford a mask, though Then we have the bird-couple: Hawkgirl and Hawkman  Their sole reason for being in the show is because their original arch-nemesis, Hath-Set, has been unapologetically merged with Vandal Savage in DC's worst mistake so far  Their gimmick is that they are the only ones capable of killing Savage  Their acting is atrocious, but the studio probably couldn't convince or afford competent actors to play mace-wielding birds Lastly, Captain Cold and Heatwave  They ran out of characters to take from 'Arrow' and 'The Flash', even after the human rights violation resulting in White Canary  My guess is that their actors (doesn't that term require the ability to act, though?) have excellent managers and now DC can't get rid of them The big bad guy is Vandal Savage  In light of 'Arrow' and 'The Flash', it surprises me that the big bad isn't a direct copy of the Legends team, perhaps with inverted colors  Then again, Black Canary already exists  However, anything would have been better than to completely and utterly ruin the magnificent character of Vandal Savage  I weep for you, Vandal To illustrate how bad this show is, here are a few highlights:1  Professor Firestorm drugs the mechanic kid, whom he is intricately linked with, to irreversibly get him to do his bidding  All is forgiven  2  To show off female empowerment, there is a bar fight scene initiated by a fat crook who wants to rape Canary  It is even worse than it sounds  3  The black market the team sneaks into is, quite literally, a market  At some point they start to auction off a nuke, but bids are placed by firing a gun at the ceiling  4  Cold and Heatwave are so edgy, they constantly have to remind the viewer that they are criminals and only want to help the team save the world so they can be better criminals  Every time Snart opens his mouth, another dimension to his character manages to escape

For those that watch or know of the Flash and the Arrow series, most of us know who they are  No intros are needed and we know about Hawkgirl/Hawkman/Vandal Savage from Arrow/Flash crossover  The only kink in the wheel was Rip Hunter  Being a big fan of Dr  Who and Mr/ Mrs Amy Pond, I think Arthur Darvill does a good job, not knowing anything about the comic book character  I thought it mimicked Dr  Who, maybe that is where they were going with the comic  Just the story is enough to remind me  Time Masters/Time Lord, time spaceship/big blue box that's bigger on the inside  The thing we did not know was Rip's relation to Savage and why he is traveling through time for one man  Savage causes destruction, but maybe more personal than that  I cannot help but wonder if Savage is what Merlin was trying to warn Oliver about  He did not say it outright though  Merlin said that are more things in play than Oliver knows and cannot put Nyssa in charge of the League because Merlin did scoop up some of Salvage at the end of the crossover event  It would be interesting to see how it relates together  The other thing is Gideon  I thought Gideon is built by Barry Allen, but yet Eobard Thawne uses Gideon to keep tabs on the timeline and now Rip Hunter uses Gideon for his ship  I am guessing Gideon is the super- computer for the future where anyone can use it

Before I start I have to say, I will mention the Arrow and the Flash too in this review I haven't reviewed anything else because I simply don't hate something as much as I do this and I have to let people know  I don't hate the storyline, what I hate is how they go about it  This series has so much potential, and it's wasted  The thing I hate the most is how stupidly illogical it is that basically everyone survives, no matter how dire the situation  OK yes, Carter died, but the rest of them should be dead by now too  You know Rip takes on Vandal Savage who could barely be defeated by team Arrow and team Flash but he is easily defeated by Rip who has nothing special  No, the thing that annoyed me on top of it all is when the Bounty Hunter came from the future and vaporised 2 kids with a single shot  Extremely accurate and lethal, until of course he shoots Martin Stein, who doesn't vaporise, no he doesn't even get injured for more than 10 seconds The stupidity of no one dying just makes the series so predictable, why watch? I know everyone will survive, kill Savage and happy ending  That's a joke  If a clear reason why nobody is being killed like they have extreme superpowers, all of them should be dead by now  Exactly the same as Arrow, the first season was good, it was all very logical and everything happened for a reason but then it got stupid, they run towards so many soldiers who are all shooting guns but nobody even gets shot, Arrow somehow beats Slade, who is and exceptional fighter and has Mira Kiru, he beats Ras Al Ghul, who was a better fighter, and no doubt in some stupid way, he will beat Damien Darhk  One example of this is how Damien had the Arrow ip choked with a chain and the Arrow somehow manages to throw an Arrow with enough force while he can't breathe that, Damien, a former league of assassins member couldn't dodge the arrow  The episode of Sara Lance getting her soul back was even more stupid, the writers had to forge some crap out of thin air to get her back, I thought something interesting might happen you know? Thea dies, but no, they just made a magician in their writing out of thin air because why not right? We don't want our main characters to die so let's not let them  The Flash, the only series I like because everything that happens is for a reason and the things behind it are great except one thing, I don't understand why the Flash doesn't just carry his meta-humans into the cage which they can't get out of instead of fighting them? He can do that before they can react can't he? Anyway, I know the Flash will win in some stupid way that they will just bring in, or something that makes no sense will happen and he will beat Zoom  This is just a constant repetition in all the series that I have listed and frankly, it's boring to watch and a waste of time

While Legends of Tomorrow is better than anything Marvel is doing with their network shows, this is kind of awful by DC TV standards  There is some good  The writing is above average and the production quality is pretty good  The problem is with the acting  Oh my god  It's not good  For some reason they've insisted on focusing on the hawk man and Hawkgirl along with firestorm and white canary, and these are all of the worst actors on the show, maybe even the worst on TV It's really a shame when they've got actual good actors in Victor Garber, even Dominic Purcell, Wentworth Miller and Brandon Routh are good at playing caricatures of themselves  Compared to Flash, Arrow and even Gotham, this show is underwhelming

Just as they disappointed in Arrow season 3 and current season 4, so did they here  A good storyline copied from Justice League of America but poorly written for a live action series  A Hawk Girl with over grown teeth who becomes worse when she starts to act  If you want to see Justice League, go watch Justice League of America, if you want to see some unimportant character from DC Universe, go watch Justice League Unlimited  If you are a fan of time traveling watch Doctor Who  If you want to see Mr  Miller and Mr  Purcell watch Prison Break  So dumb series  Highly disappointing  If you are going to copy your plot from a successful cartoon series, do it right  Waste of great actors like Miller, Purcell and Routh

I really want to love this show, but I am having a heck of a time  I can't even count how many times the freeze and fire guns have been shot, yet I haven't seen anything freeze or burn yet  Dominic and Wentworth are hugely entertaining, I'd even go so far as to say they're the best thing this show has to offer, and damned glad Dom got clear of the cliché bad guy movies he was stuck in for a while, in this, he is fun  These guys have been an item since Prison Break, and I'm thrilled to see them in this As I write this review, on either side of the screen are BatBen and SuperHenry, reminding me that DC does have some real creativity to offer, though only Henry has any business being in that position IMO The animation of the past decade, even back to the WB Batman/Superman cartoons, were brilliant, fun and compelling, almost even  believable  as far as that can go You are missing the boat DC, figure it out fast, or Marvel will just continue to leave you in the dust  It's just not fun when you make glaringly stupid moves after a long, well-planned story-line comes to fruition  I hope it gets better, but since Arrow and Flash seem to continue, I'll bet this does too  There's far worse stuff on TV, and this is still kinda fun  PLEASE TRY HARDER!!!

O noes! a very bad evil guy in the future is very very evil  Quick, to the time travel machine to get some heroes from 2016 !  tadadadadada (old batman screen switcher gingle)  We need to assemble average heroes who doesn't have a show yet   What about the black canary who died last season in arrow    we could resurrect her   GREAT  Then the 2 annoying brother will certainly add to the tension with their awful speechs    And what about those two shitty disguise hawks    yhea and atom guy   because we need an humoristic average joe which the audience can relate with    NICES  You team are reunite at the top of this building because I need you  You see, in the future (hand gesture to the sky, adding tension) there is this dude who is bad    I need you all to defeat him  If you accept, meet me at this address 'hand over a printed business card'  I need you, HUMANITY NEEDS YOU     earth need you! we are 10 minutes in the first episodeI stopped watching right there  Was it supposed to be an humoristic show   Is TV show sinked that low  When i was 9 year old, I imagine stories for my legos   and I think i manage to get more logic, tension and overall better dialogs than this show  It is 80's Batman or Power Ranger all over again    So cheesy, so lame  What a waste of actors, times and money  Avoid this one like plague  Don't feed stupidity

I wanted to like the show, even a little but it's very hard  I don't mind arrow, the flash is watchable, supergirl is comical but this show just sucks Where to start  All of the heroes attacks don't even work on plain humans  The fight scenes are horrible, you see the fire and freeze guns shoot with absolutely no effect on anything, firestorm and atom fare the same  In one scene it looks like the same 10 human security guards are knocked down and thrown back and just rush forward again and again I feel sorry for the actors, they were decent in the other shows but it didn't seem like they were happy with the dialog or story either  They deserve writers who can write a half decent story  I will not get into plot issues  I could overlook that if it was at least entertaining, but it was just painful to watch I will force myself to watch the third episode, on the off chance things improve, not expecting anything here

This is a series that I was looking forward to seeing having grown up in the silver age of comics  Although Superman and Co  dominated the DC universe, lesser known titles like Challengers of the Unknown and Rip Hunter, Time Master generally provided a broader range of stories  The original Rip Hunter was not a time-lord style hero from the future with a band of super heroes/villains  He was a contemporary inventor whose creation, the time sphere, allowed him and sever human (but not super) to travel through time  Unfortunately, the new TV show has retconned Rip into something else entirely  It is a fact, however, that writers at DC (and Marvel) seem to have been given carte blanche to retcon at any time to remake any character as they see fit so screw consistency In any case, the major failing seems to be that we are going to get a band of adventurers pursuing one villain with each episode likely reduced to  we caught up with him, we fought him, and he got away   Then there is the same problem we see frequently in The Flash - the characters forgetting that they have specific weapons/abilities  And not just the so-called heroes  In episode 2, the people at the auction bid by firing their guns in the air but when the fighting breaks out they resort to punching? Too many situations in The Flash could have been resolved quickly if only Barry could remember  hey, I can run really really fast   When the writers assume that the viewers are morons I just stop watching Doesn't anyone realize that just because Savage is immortal doesn't mean he can't be tied up?Plus I can't help but cringe every time I hear Snart or Rory speak

I have never been a fun of D C's comics so I don't watch arrow but I watch flash    I also watch the new show legends of tomorrow it's fun and am enjoying it    It has great ratings    I love the cast they are so amazing    Can't wait for the new episodes    My Thursday's not boring anymore!! Awesome  My favorite is captain cold and Sara lance am also beginning to love firestorm one thing I don't like is the hawkgirl and hawk man story but now that hawkman is gone am looking forward to see were that story line will go  Vandal savage plays his role really good I think that role suits him    Am sooo curious to know how episode 3 will be am sooo stocked  I would rather legends of tomorrow than arrow

I don't know what to say  I mean this show is amazing! people should definitely watch it  there are many things that surprises you and makes you excited in the series  the time traveling and super technology got me crazy  everyone has it's own power and the show is nailing it more than Arrow and The Flash! but no one can be Stephen Amell for sure! I actually like kind of supernatural or super power stuffs and this is one of the good ones  I hope the show goes on and the cross overs keep on because seeing them together gives me chills  not to mention that I love seeing Stephen Amell everywhere they are perfect together  everything about this show is great  I hope you all like it as I did  I didn't like it, I loved it  <U+2665>

I have used IMDb for about 10 years, it has been great source of reviews and ratings  However, today I joined for the sole purpose of making an adjustment to the ratings  I have no idea how this came to have a rating of about 8-9   its simply terrible  Yes the cast have made great shows in the past, but this show is simply not worth its ratings For no other reason than to shine light on this injustice, I have joined and given this a rating of 1/10, because I could not give 0/10 I hope they end this show ASAP  Syfy shows are getting worse and worse    that needs to stop  There are great novels which to base the shows on

Rip Hunter from the 22 century travels back in time to put together a group of super power beings to stop an evil powerful immortal named Vandal Savage, but will this team learn to work together before it's too late?It's a cool concept even though the team up is not based on a comic book like The Avengers and Justice League, although these characters in the show are well known in the DC universe  Sometimes I feel like I'm watching a mixture of Avengers and Guardians of The Galaxy  The cast do play off each other perfectly, I can tell by watching this that they all are having fun working on this  Even Brandon Routh as The Atom, he basically looks like The Incredible Shrinking Iron Man  Dialog can get clunky in spots, but it is a fun show regardless  I hope it gets better has it goes on

Spoilers, don't read if you haven't watched unless you are OK with plot spoilers If you are looking for DC's answer to all the great Marvel programming out there, this is not it    or even worse   I guess it is  It's the same CW teen-fest hero show, but much worse  The acting is terrible (I'm looking at you former Prison Break brothers, though they are hardly the only guilty ones)  The writing is cheesy and childish in it's simplistic stereotype play to each character   Never mind that DC characters just aren't all that interesting (an Ant Man knockoff played by the former one-off Superman, a pair of criminal brothers with heat and cold ray gun?)  The only 2 with an interesting story    are just lame    Hawnkgirl and Hawkman? And the villain is really the only good overall character    which is OK if he is just the best of the group   but he is the only good one on the show  Even the reason they are all together isn't all that compelling  A time traveler on a revenge trip that lies to everyone    but they stick around for episode 2 anyway? The team predictably ignores is warnings about time at every turn  And finally   the CGI     you get the picture  Just don't waste your time on this one unless you're a super fan of the other CW superhero shows

I was really excited about this show  I like all super hero stuff on TV and movies, as I am not informed about the comic books I watched the pilot, and thought may be I will give it another try  I watched the second episode and decided I will NOT watch it any more Over acting Poor story telling The Sheyara girl is horrible in many aspects  All these super powers and the bad guy seems to do just fine As early as the second episode the story line got convoluted  I have a feeling this will get worse I hope I am wrong and others enjoy it

This is possibly worse than power rangers  The effects are so,so but the storyline is so bad a cheesy that you cringe  Only thing worse than the storyline,is the acting Which make you wonder if they are actually trying to get a razzie award on purpose  I dunno what happened ,but the comics I read my childhood firestorm was a white guy And him and the professor didn't need to hold hands nor be in the same room  to merge into firestorm  Not to mention he was a kick ass superhero Here he mostly argue with the professor incessantly Hawk and hawk girl didn't have wings attached to their body  it was attached to a belt  Atoms suit was way less clunky,than what we see in this show  But I guess some of the things have changed or it's a new generation or something Either way,the chemistry between all of them, are so bad I cringe when they speak or interact with each other  Lest not forget they can't hit a single thing,they shot and blast fireballs and what not but they can't seem to hit a single person  And as usual they make the female heroes helpless once their man is down  Watching two episodes of this,make me wanna charge em with crimes against humanity

I love this show! Maybe I'm old enough to know better, but they do entertain me  There's no nudity, profanity, over-the-top blood and gore or any of the things most of the current line-up of shows have  I like the characters, even the cheesy Doctor Who wannabe  I'm not looking for reality TV, crime dramas or trashy comedies  I don't have any unreal expectations about the writers or the story line  The actors can act well enough to present their characters realistically  There's fun tech toys, big explosions and pretty people  That's entertainment  I like having Arrow, Flash and, now, Legends available  They're fun and nothing more  Works for me!

I'm gonna confess  I was so excited for the premiere of the show, because I love Arrow and The Flash even more, I was almost certain I would love DC's Legends Of Tomorrow  Well, my expectations were a little bit too high, I can't say that I had that feeling as I had watching the first episode of Arrow and The Flash, but it's decent enough and I'm going to stick with this show to see where the plot is heading I loved the idea of using known characters, but unfortunately, I don't see much dynamic yet, but we're in the beginning, so we must be a little more patience  Time travel was other thing that caught my attention too, so that was the cause for my high expectations  Meanwhile, I felt the first episode kinda of rushed, the events, and even if I have a crush for parenting plots, I'm not sure if the Hunter's plot is strong enough to carry the first season Even so, I'm going to watch this show evolving and see if it can reach the level of Arrow and The Flash and also be an independent and solid show

I've had to pause the second episode in order to write this review, as a sincere fan of Prison Break, as well of Caity and Victor Garber, I find the show acceptable under some terms of changes  I was to find The Flash and Arrow as entertaining works which targets a certain category of fans, although I believed that I might be interested in the world of DC and it was not such a bad decision  My interests are normally related to the direction as well as the performance of the actors which I find fairly fine, I write about Wentworth, Dominic, Victor, Caity and Brandon as well as Arthur  I'm sure by the time I write this, then possible the screenplay has been agreed on at least a full season but my mere advice is to never undermine the minds of those who watch the show since it could be a bit demeaning and rather ridiculous  I encountered many silly events within Arrow and less on The Flash, so I would say Legends of Tomorrow could be a chance to amend the absurdities of which happened on the mentioned shows I also need to notify that the Egyptian language used within the quick dialogue is a slang modern language which could not be used thousands of years ago, perhaps 1975 and few decades before but not older than this Thanks,

I was excited to see my old favorite, Arthur Darvill (Rory Williams - Doctor Who), as a lead - and so many of the B-Team character from Arrow & Flash, finally getting their own show and more development    This is totally FUN! ;o)Perfect? Nothing IS!   But it's so sad to hear so many reviewers on here totally missing the point 1st >>> There are the first-time viewers, that did not see the introduction and development of all these characters, prior to Legends, on Arrow & Flash 2nd >>> There are the comic book readers, who are expecting their comic book characters to be brought to life,  as is , into a live TV series  I am SO glad I don't like comics! I don't have this bias  Anyone who (again) has watched Arrow & Flash, knows these are  adaptions   I liked all of these characters & actors prior to coming into Legends, from watching them on Arrow & Flash  So I was able to watch Legends, hitting the ground running, and just enjoy it    !It also didn't hurt seeing Arthur Darvill act in some 27 episodes of Dr Who, prior  Totally worth the binge watch, if you haven't! What fun seeing a Time Lord ;o)    errr, sorry,  Master     zippin' around time & space, with  Companions , saving the future of the world!   But no super-being, just an ordinary human, with a wife & son, who he just wants to save!For our  comic reading  friends, get over yourselves and  adapt  to the adaptations  For those who are coming into it blind, do us, and yourself, a favor and watch Arrow & The Flash (before complaining)     For the rest of us, we're just going to settle in with our popcorn and ENJOY! ;o)

From the point view of someone who didn't read comics all his life,but likes superhero movies and series,this one is just horrid  I know it has been just one episode ,but it is so lame it just can't keep your attention  The conversations are predictable,the one liners are just boring, and I am sorry but these are superheroes who will save the world - when their time travel ship got attacked,the fire-dude ( the professor and the other guy fused together) and the other flying dude could not hit the time-headhunter guy to save their lives  They literally we spraying fire and whatever the other dude shoots all around him,but couldn't hit him   If I was that bad at my job ,as they are bad at superheroing ,I would be fired  :D I saw Jessica Jones,and that was interesting through the season, the Flash was OK, I never liked green arrow, so I guess if someone is a fan of those,he will like Legends of Tomorrow also, but for the average Joe,I don't think it sparks interest,it is just badly made

The show is very ambitious, the marketing did a good job with the hype and they painstakingly set up the premises over a long time in the Arrow and Flash shows  I was looking forwards to seeing ATOM in action as we got very little of him, I liked how Vandal Savage and Hawkgirl were introduced in Flash but the first episode was a complete mess  First of all there are way too many character on screen at the same time for anything meaningful to occur I think that people who have not seen Flash or Arrow before will have an even harder time to make sense of all the characters but even will after seeing those shows the plot and directing is just average at best  The show cant pace itself out right, sets some grand scale premises but then gets tangled in its own web and the climax fight with Chronos is simply brain numbing - it just an excuse to see all 9 characters shoot at something(and by miracle missing and getting their asses kicked despite being a 9vs1 fight against a guy that has an armor and gun)  I would like to see this show get off the ground but it's very unlikely since I think the director of the show just cant pull it off

Simply put, the shows initial hype had me intrigued  I'm a huge fan of DC and Marvel, but if this is the best black actor they could find to portray the character the show designated as  Firestorm  aka Jax, DC should stop letting comics be converted by The CW, as it destroys any hope of remaining remotely true to the comics' integrity  I understand script and directing issues may have their hand in some of the problems with this show, the acting by Drameh is no better than an elementary school play, and he very well may be a decent actor    somewhere  Save us O'lord, from Firestorm  He's just so     so    bad  That being said, the show as a whole is all over the place  The plot, , the writing, the acting, the CGI, and the delivery seemed to be tossed randomly into the air, hoping for something good to fall back to earth  I'll admit was kind of stoked that Purcell and Miller were together again after Prison Break, but I don't know how to view the character roles yet  It is definitely a kids show, and I suppose that is no surprise given The CW is a teeny-bopper network  If this theatrical mess continues on its current path, I'd be surprised if it lasts an entire season  It seems like the show was rushed, like the crew of the show needed a payday loan  I really wanted to like the show and I encourage giving this show a chance because everyone's taste is different, but user beware, you may find yourself throat punching someone afterward

So you have the avenger's B team    or is it C team? probably D team or lower   Anyway these are the ones that get an episode or two in the regular series and then a few guest appearances if they're lucky Put them all together with a time lord errrr traveler, totally meant to say traveler! and have them go through time trying to stop a manic before he rules the world The plot line sounds like a goofy fan fiction written by a tween and has the usual GLARING problem time travel causes (a person died? go back an hour and save them then? plan failed? you have a time machine with zero limitations USE IT!!!!) but oddly enough, it works and most of it comes from the characters and actors Heatwave (from the Netflex series the flash) is funny, not sure if most of it was intentional or not but once he opens his mouth you'll end up falling for him!The old prof  from the duo firestorm (again from the flash series) steals the show    though I'm not sure about some of the choices his character makes  still lovable and you get invested in him The rest all have their moments and are actually likable  I'd say this show is off to a VERY good start! (regadless of the childish plot)One problem I see with the show is the two that are supposed to be the main leads, hawkman and girl  they're boring as white bread  Seriously all they do is pose for the camera and have zero presences  Take them out of the show and you won't even miss them! hopefully they actually get a personality later because from their show and this one all they seem to be is a plot device      also if they can actually give us a reason for the time travel thing (like really that bit is so childish!) that would make sense    it's already istablished that the traveler is human and not an almight time lord that can see beyond the ripples of time so why not jump back in time to 5 minutes before your family is killed and get them out of there?Keep an eye out for the D team, This one has potential despite the overly childish plot! can go well or burn in flames!

and he wants his trench coat back So here we have a stylish but disgraced time lord with a British accent who has stolen a time machine / spaceship and travels with companions to find adventure  Is there anything about Doctor Who they forgot to steal for that character?At least the stolen material makes sense, something that can't be said about any other aspect of the show The entire plot of the first episode was about finding someone who could place Vandal Savage at some place in time, but they already had Hawkman, who could provide more than just a guess about where Savage would be, throughout all of post-Egyptian history And then there was the big fight scene  If this super-team can't take down a single Boba Fet knock-off (and that line from Captain Cold was almost worth sitting through the rest of the show to get to  Almost   ), what hope could they possible have of defeating the main baddie? I don't think it's a sure thing they will even win all of their bar fights If your taste in entertainment is unsophisticated you may find entertainment here  For those of you older than 12, best to look elsewhere

Just ignore every single freaking annoying negative comment about this show and watch it  The first episode, and people are already being annoying as ****  I might sound biased, but I was really excited and waited SO LONG to watch this show, and it payed off  I screamed a couple of times because it felt so much like watching the Avengers again, only on the small screen, mixed with my favorite Arrow and Flash characters, combined with that of a  Star Wars  and  Dr  Who  feel to it  The first episode already had me thinking  Wow, this show is gonna be freaking amazing!  They show a dystopia future with a Star Wars type setting and people firing laser blasts and killing people  On top of that, they have Vandal FREAKING Savage (emphasis on Savage) practically murdering a 5 yr old on screen! You can tell just by the first 3 minutes that this show isn't gonna be boring at all! Plus TIME TRAVEL!! Imagine being able to see Star City and Central City in the future! The fight sequences were amazing and the CGI looks amazing on a TV budget  Had this been a show set sometimes in 2001 or 2000, it would have looked pretty crappy (Just watch Smallville and Charmed during their flying sequences and compare it to this show, and don't get me wrong, I loved those 2 shows as well)  What really sells it, is that they're able to pull off A FREAKING superhero that can shrink down to microscopic size, and on top of that, it being an Iron Man parody that is Brandon Routh playing Ray Palmer in an EXOSUIT! (Agents of Shield has no excuse for not being able to get Iron Man on the show now)  It's an amazing show, first episode and I'm already hooked  If people are looking for a Breaking Bad or a Walking Dead type super violent show, or a  Realistic  show, than I suggest you watch something else cause your not getting it here  Oh and you negative reviewers, go **** yourselves

It was painful to watch the first episode of Legends of Tomorrow  Plot holes in the first episode  Bad acting  Bad CGI and a boring story Took a lot of willpower just to finish one episode, DC should stick to animated movies   The humor was predictable and childish  Rip hunter; I am from London oh and the future      that is probably the worst line I ever heard in anything from DC  It was brought as supposed to be funny but was incredibly cringe worthy  White Canary looks ridiculous  As does Ray Palmer's suit Let's try and end with a positive note, I did like Randal Savage

My observations from the Pilot: 1  Very predictable  For every one person who wants to join the mission, one says no  Maybe hurried writing?2  I loved Caity Lotz (Sara) in the Arrow, but her acting seems wooden here  But her stunts were bad-ass 3  Victor Garber seems the most genuine in his role  He fits it perfectly  What a great actor  4  Dominic Purcell/Heat Wave is more muscle and less anything else  At least now  I understand Captain Cold/ Wentworth Miller in the team but Heat Wave makes no sense, considering there's already Firestorm, and Heat Wave isn't the brightest of the bunch!5  It has it's twists, however small  I loved how they show heroes want to matter in history 6  I know my title says it's a mix of Dr  Who and Avengers but it is original  Just hoping they don't waste the potential on too much drama and include big time travel jumps and a lot of action

Its new so all the actors are finding their way with the characters as usual with all new series  You can accept that and move on but from the off its quite apparent that this is aimed at kids/families and not a more mature audience  So if you are looking for something to watch that you can enjoy with the kids its a good watch but if you are looking for something more akin to the Marvel movies you will be disappointed The writing is about what you would expect too for family drama  As an example of this it doesn't expect you to question why the time traveler, Captain Hunter, when he states he has collected the 8 greatest people in history to become legends why wouldn't he recruit Iron Man       Thor       Spider Man     Aqua Man     O K maybe not Aqua Man but you get my point  Just sit back and gloss over the plot holes and enjoy it with the kids  Its like someone took Dr Who and mashed it together with Marvel Heroes in a very a typical Hollywood styling and hey voila you have this When I say its for kids I mean think Dr Who for kids not Power Rangers for kids so as I say this will appeal to some but not for anyone looking for a serious comic book TV flick

Am I missing something here? I don't watch Doctor Who  Is this Doctor Who meets Justice League? Why is this so awful? Every character is unlikable  They go back in time and take on social injustice? They're not even fighting super villains anymore? Half the cast changed after the first season  This is a huge mess  If this is considered good for the genre (the genre of sci-fi time hopping) then I must dislike the genre itself If they didn't tie into the Flash and the Arrow I wouldn't watch this  I guess I'm just not into watching people play dress up from other eras and using historic characters like name-dropping so to keep the audience captivated  Lazy writing  But even the sci-fi stuff looks cheap and lazy  Talking spaceship  Poo  This show is a big failure I'd suggest going and watching Agents of Shield

This looks to be building to a series as enjoyable as flash/arrow/supergirl The fact that it's getting negative review is a good thing, it shows it's embracing DC comics universe history of time-travel and multiple earths to deliver a gem to the fans, and that vocal idiots aren't going to appreciate it because they'll just never get it This series has the potential to embrace all the amazingly complex Infinite stories that made DC comics a hit from the 70's onwards  Given Marvel is outdoing them on the realism front, it makes sense to embrace their more out-there storytelling which wired for them in the past That said it's fun, easy to get into, action pact, and flows from Arrow/Flash, so anyone should be able to get into it and enjoy it  Unless they get their jollies moaning on IMDb, but at that point there's no hope

I grew up reading comics with Atom, and Hawkman and Hawkgirl so I was pretty stoked when I saw the previews for this show  (Firestorm and Black Canary's sister weren't around then but they are interesting characters)  Since becoming a fan of the Flash and Supergirl TV shows, having another DC series was an exciting prospect  Then I watched the show's first episode  Meh    Complaints? The Atom I knew didn't have a power suit that makes him into a DC clone of Iron Man  That is the first one  The second one, and it is my main reason for ditching the show after 1 episode is this: (spoiler alert for 1st episode): If the group couldn't even defeat the Bounty Hunter Chronos, how the H*** are they going to stand a chance against Savage? I mean, come on! Hawkgirl and Hawkman both hit Chronos with their Nth metal maces and it barely knocks him down  Then Capt  Hunter hits him with a laser gun  No affect  Then Snart and Rory run into him with a car  Knocks him down  Next, Firestorm fires energy blasts at him along with Snart and Rory's cold and fire guns  Nada  Lastly, the ship, which has weapons, runs rather than fight a single entity on the ground with a hand-held weapon? And, oh yeah, why were Dr  Stein and Dr  Boardman each hit with a blast from Chronos' weapon and yet Stein wasn't even singed yet Boardman dies? This dysfunctional group couldn't beat anyone so let's quit pretending they are up to the task  As always, make the superheros' powers worthless until the last battle and then suddenly they will prevail - that is the tired formula that will probably be used for this series so save your DVR space for something worthwhile

To be honest, with the exception of Arrow Season 1, the tone and direction of  Arrow  and  Flash  remind me of  Smallville   They are all full of this teeny American cheesy feel-good-factor that gets on my nerves  So disappointed to have to say that  Legends of tomorrow  manages to be even worse The first 10 minutes are so unbelievably rushed  No story or background build up, apart from seeing a terrorised city and a kid being killed by a B-rate villain  A villain who doesn't even strike any kind of charisma  I am wondering why the hell is he the main villain, when there were so many they could have chosen   Time travelling? Seriously? Couldn't the producers have come up with something a bit more original?? And just like your Smallville, Arrow and Flash, everything is so conspired to the point of sickly sweet, with characters behaving totally against their usual selves Maybe this commercial product is good enough for teens but any self-respecting DC fan will steer clear of it  An absolute disgrace  I might as well be watching  Mutant X  all over again

If you watch this kind of show, then you know which one this series is attempting to copy  As my thirteen-year-old son told me, after we saw the first episode,  master  is a synonym for  lord  In a forced attempt to make this one somehow different from Greg Berlanti's other three shows ( Arrow,   Flash,  and  Supergirl ), this one apparently includes attempted comedy  It doesn't work very well because, first, all four of these clones have their characters tossing snarky lines around, so the contrast isn't very stark, and, second, the silly things they say do contrast internally: with the serious things they say  It's as though the characters alternate between short speeches about the grandeur of their individual destinies, and the silliness inherent in asking a nerd if he's ever played football On top of all that, there is a serious plot flaw that appears at the end of the first episode, which (no spoilers here) forces the viewer to accept the idea that all of these people will agree to something that at least a few of them would realize might be a very bad idea  It is simply not believable  (I know, that's a word with little application to a show about comic book superheroes, but there are lines, and there are lines, right?)For context, I would score the foursome this way:Arrow, 8 0 (trending down)Supergirl, 7 5 (trending up)Flash, 7 0 (trending flat)Legends of Tomorrow 4 0 (but I'll watch two more, at least)Note: I went to a science fiction convention a week ago  One of the discussion panels was about how so many of us are suffering from  superhero overload  from TV shows like this one  It was a popular panel, with the consensus being very, very one-sided  I sense the end is near for a lot of this stuff, at least on TV

It is quite a great show because in the beginning starting with Arrow back from season 1 since 2012 and then The Flash came since 2014  Slowly after these 2 shows has started, it slowly building up everything such as the timeline between one show and another show  Also the 2 shows started a crossover which lasted for only 2 episodes for each season so far  Was surprised about who the team members were and the future was good especially how the wormhole was done with good CGI among with other special effects  Was also quite surprised about how the year started in the far future and went back in time  This would be a great show to watch along with surprises that will be in the 16 episodes for this season and possible beyond

This is quite literally the most poorly written pilot of any show I have seen in a decade  The story is poorly adapted from the concept of Dr  Who  The writing not only lacks any sense of direction, but it also makes every character utterly detestable  You could find better acting in Adam Sandler's Ridiculous 6 (in other words, it is the worst acting on television)  The only bright spot in the show is that it obviously has a huge production budget and therefore the scenery and special effects are well done Do not waste your precious time on this show, you can never get it back  Unless America has dropped its standards to a new low, this show will not be renewed for a second season

I like to give any fantasy / sci-fi series or movie a chance, but Legends of Tomorrow makes it hard from episode one For me the actors were mediocre at best  The guy playing Captain Hunter overacted a lot and the rest were given too little time to actually care about in the first episode The directing, writing and effects seem quite underwhelming in general  The plot is forced by making time travel and those that 'master' it seem ridiculous as well as pulling off a new team in a contrived manner with little logic behind it Especially the 'big battle' was lame  Atom and Fireguy shooting randomly making sure not to hit the enemy, Hawkcouple hitting him and then flying off when he's on the ground  The entire scene was done rather poorly  Worse of all were the people running in a straight line when a supposed bounty hunter is shooting at them and then not being hurt when getting shot (except for the expandable character)     I thought we were past this kind of fight scenes for over two decades I also have a hard time seeing a future for this show given the premise of killing 'facial hair man' kind of puts an end date on the show from the very start, ironic for a time travel show with limitless possibilities to chose from The only things I liked from the first show were the bar fight, the hot chick, the hot actors and the backstory of Hawkcouple and facial hair man, although the latter could have been given a bit more depth Hawkgirl still needs flying lessons apparently, I hope she can help the series rise to a new level or it's doomed to fall to a bloody death sooner than later

(contains harmless spoilers)this is my first review  i am writing this because of the criticism being faced by this series  I have been a DC fan since i watched Superman: the animated series when i was three  Introduction to justice league and arrowverse have only made me a greater fan  As the pilot was telecast 12 hrs after the US telecast, i sat back and watched it  trust me, it lives up to the expectations  i will just list the pros and cons:PROS: -Arthur Davill is great as Rip Hunter -White Canary's bar fight feat  heatwave and captain cold -Character development of Ray Palmer -The special effects -the twists and turns -hawkman and hawkgirl have strong presence -lots of characters so lots of varietyCons: -Vandal Savage is underwhelming -CW divides the pilot keeping most of the action for next week(main reason for mixed reviews) -the death of the guest star is not a big issue, even his mother doesn't care -some scenes are ended in gibberish due to uneven pacingi don't think legends is trying to be a TV series in top ten lists  it is a good show with a bumpy start but a lot of promising adventures  Not every sci-fi has to be as good as battlestar galactica or firefly  Some are watched for their craziness

If you love Arrow and the Flash you are absolutely going to love this also  The pilot was great and it showed how Rip hunter assembles his team and their first time travel most of which has already been shown in the trailers   People might say the Special effects are bad, but for the budget of a TV show they've done a splendid work Some might pit this against Daredevil or Jessica jones  But those are more grounded shows  This is a Fun time travel show and uses the same formula which made everyone love the Flash  Don't look at the bad reviews you cannot please everybody, it's only the pilot and there's much more to come  My opinion is that it'll live up to the Hype  No surprise there cause it's a spin off of two of the best TV shows  Go watch it, you'll love it   :)

It's odd to see legendary premise from Seven Samurais implemented with supporting heroes from DC Universe and time travel gimmick  This is similar to a sport team made out of benchwarmers, without being too rude, and it can be disjointed at times  However, the theme of being better than the destined supporting roles resonate in rather realistic fashion for these misfits and its bombastic approach is surprisingly fun in contrast of trending gritty vibe for superheroes nowadays Brandon Routh, formerly Superman, now goes by the name of Atom is a welcomed addition  He has good screen presence and it's nice to see him don another superhero suit in more prominent role  Wentworth Miller and Dominic Purcell once again become brothers years after their Prison Break time together  They've done this before and it seems they find comfortable place among the crew Victor Garber, the half part of Firestorm and Caity Lotz, now White Canary are proper additions  Garber has done so many roles similar to this and he fits the mentor personality, while Lotz looks fine for the tough female character  She is athletic for the part, she's also gradually separating herself from love interest character into a more establish one  Arthur Darvill as the new lead Rip Hunter looks enigmatically resembling Constantine, though he seems decent for the glue that keeps the band together These are the most likely to have chemistry across times  Unfortunately, this type of gathered heroes gig needs everyone to play their part  The Hawk duo is still inconsistent, they lack connection and the level or refined acting, and this is more visible when they play important part on the plot  Franz Drameh, the face of Firestorm has not meshed well with the rest either, the character looks too forced even if he's paired with more experienced Victor Garber For visual candy purpose, they haven't skimped on the production  Effects from The Flash and Arrow translate well here  Atmosphere is leaning towards The Flash's lighter ambiance as the show gives more time for humor, thus the inevitable corny one-liner  Few of these appear highly flashy and haphazardly thrown together, although they are entertaining to have nonetheless The assembly from lesser characters can be risky and hectic, yet the better parts of the production and cast present an enjoyable ride  Besides, it's always good to watch the talented actors given more spotlights and experience a more merry leisure than melancholy or melodramatic shows

The plot, music, production, and cinematography is as you'd expect - EXCEPT for the flow of quality acting  Two 'actors' in particular are painful to listen and watch, because they're fish out of water when interacting with the other pro actors: - Franz Drameh (Firestorm) - Falk Hentschel (Carter) Let's start with Franz  His inability to act is obvious  He needs to go to acting school (or return there)  He has little to no confidence in his speaking abilities and overcompensates for this by shaking or nodding his head with a stretched smile at the beginning (or end) of every sentence  HE'S NOT READY TO ACT Falk is a disaster  He should stick to voice animation and not acting  He doesn't enunciate (speak clearly) and speeds through his sentences  His facial expressions hardly even change - and just like Franz, NOT READY FOR ACTING  Just because Falk is 'hot & ripped' doesn't mean he's prepared for the big screen  So prepare to be disappointed with 'Legends of Tomorrow'

After the pilot it seems like the same thing again with similar color palate of Arrow and Flash  Do we really need another series to cross over? Why not just have these characters in Arrow or Flash? They are both running out of ideas  The only difference is the time travel element  It's great to have Caity Lotz again in a series - killing her off in Arrow was a terrible mistake so they had to bring her back  Brandon Routh is okay as supporting cast in Arrow not sure about leading a series  The British actor Darvill is a bit common - couldn't they get someone more charismatic? From what I've seen so far I don't think it's worth the time investment
