It's difficult writing this review as I am a big DC fan and was anticipating this show for a while  But from a critical perspective, this show definitely utilizes some of the lesser known DC characters and groups them together in a new superhero offering, with a certain degree of success The story-line is not too difficult to follow, and the first episode certainly paints a picture of things to come, so I am quietly optimistic the concept will deliver  There are plenty of angles to explore with the idea of time travel, so hopefully this show has proved it has created an unusual yet refreshing team worth watching There are some downfalls - some of the dialogue seems strained, and at this early stage there isn't a lot of character interaction, much like a JLA comic from the 1950's  I am personally not a fan of having Captain Cold nor Heatwave on the show, as their combination of sneering and screaming acting is somewhat cringe-worthy  I would've preferred to see some of the lesser known JLA instead, such as Vixen or Zatanna Brandon Routh seems to be the standout star of the show as his character is the most likable and appealing  The rest of the cast   well, time will tell The makers of this show have done a thorough job and it shows  I am hopeful this show will create a whole new direction in superhero television programs

First off, I loved comicbook movies/shows ESPECIALLY if it has a connected universe  I been watching the CW universe unfold on Netflix so as soon as I heard this was happening, I knew I couldn't wait for it to come onto Netflix 9 months later I have currently watched Arrow seasons 1-3 and The Flash season 1, both shows as great as this one  So I had not watched a single Arrow season 4 or The Flash season 2 episode at all, and started immediately watching Legends of Tomorrow without that helpful knowledge AND STILL understood what was happening without being lost The pilot episode has a great intro showing the level of damage Vandal Savage can do, making the world into a dystopia  It sets up the villain really well here and what the point of the show is as well  This show is like The Avengers with Time travel 10/10

Another silly TV show of DC  the writing and the fight scenes are for laughs  As about visually the sgi was terrible   I bet in a few episodes will become cheesy soap opera TV like arrow,smallville and pretty much everything predictable that DC is serving to its teenager viewers  Let's be honest now  can you compare that fight scenes, acting and writing with all the amazing Marvel TV shows out there?  NO  The Hawks are really annoying,an ex Superman that nobody liked, all though DC doesn't care about it  and they used him again,the 2 ex prison break brothers with their annoying speech problem they have, arrow's ex girlfriend who died in arrow and got resurrected,a doctor who character and the duo firestorm  and tah tah   we have a boring predictable super hero new TV show

It's true    these are the characters that are widely forgettable  Don't get me wrong, I liked Palmer in Arrow and I even like Stein, but Firestorm was better with Ronnie than with  Jax   Hell, I even enjoyed Snart as a bad guy even though his dialogue and mannerisms were very cartoony  But for the rest    I never liked Sarah Lance, Heatwave is a very one-dimensional pun, Jax (the lesser half of Firestorm) is whiny and obnoxious, and the Hawk-duo are horrendous  For one (this is nit picking and probably in bad taste) I can't get past her mouth and how big her teeth are    I honestly find it distracting  Also, on the same note: why does Sarah Lance always look like she's trying to do  duck- face?  What is it with the CW and employing actresses with good bodies but weird faces? Anyway    The story idea at heart is good, but it loses momentum when you learn is a personal vendetta with Rip Hunter  It would have been better if the time council wanted Vandal Savage dealt with  The script is awkward like Arrow has become  Arrow was good until all of the good writers left and went to Flash  Nothing feels natural and most of the dialogue feels exposition-y  The only saving grace is that it removes so many annoying characters from Flash And Arrow and locks them in this world to never bother us again  But I did like Palmer and wish he would come back to Arrow  Overall, bad show  I'll keep watching just because I have now seen the first episode and feel compelled to keep watching to keep up continuity with the other two shows because I bet there's going to be cross-overs

Yes, SOME OF IT is kind of for kids   But I loved it!!! Though I wish it gets more  mature  with time  There are good actors here, so there's a lot of potential for good drama and character development, too  Still, there are just a couple of things I didn't like  I mean, Chronos is just ONE villain and not even a couple of them could hit him ONCE   That's just   not good  If one of them can't even hit the mark once, why did Rip Hunter got them together? They're supposed to be good!!! Another thing is that some of the dialogue can be a bit cheesy   SOOOO, those are the couple of things   Everything else is just perfect  There was one person here who said that if Rip had the Time Machine he could've gone back in time just to save his child and his wife and leave with them  But then, what good would that do if Savage is out there in the world ready to obliterate everyone? And Rip said, that fate and time somehow are bound together   So, in order to change the future, well, it's just really hard, hence going back to bring some  superheroes   Anyway, I LOVED IT!!!! I want more and I want more from the characters! More action, drama and character development   If it gets to cheesy and fun, then it will go down   BUT I have faith that that will NOT HAPPEN!!!! THE DC LEGENDS WILL ROCK!!!

Having waited over 7 months to see this show, it's fair to say this show has definitely lived up to, and beyond all expectations! Being a very big fan of the sister shows, Arrow and The Flash it was very interesting to see where exactly this show would fit in  Providing amasses of light and fun humour with a very enjoyable, albeit dysfunctional, superstar team completely changes the scene of superhero TV  The characters themselves are very easy to relate to as is the villain himself, Vandal Savage  A great decision to bring back Arrow character, Sara Lance to the cast as well as others from the previous two shows, giving the show a great sense of familiarity if you do watch the other two, but not so that you'd feel out of place in the slightest if you don't watch the other two  Honestly I believe this show is definitely one to check out, I really wouldn't be able to find any flaws so far  When watching it, due to the shorter season and therefore bigger budget, the show gives off the appearance of a Hollywood blockbuster  Marc Guggenheim and Andrew Kreisberg have done it again and brought us a show with brilliant special effects, great scripts and just all round badass-ery! :)

Not bad for a Soap Opera title, right? But it happens to be 100% true  Unlike my other  family in Christ,  I can watch a funny send up of the entire religion thing because BEING a full-on believer in Jesus Christ is the religion NOT the churches so-called Christians who seem to easily mix weird words from man and often worship whoever their priest or pastor is instead of believing you can read the Bible with friends and/or family and get the message  Not just GET the message, but also watch fun, entertaining Hollywood nonsense and not stray from the pack!On behalf of the many more sold out Christians, I apologize for those who are brain-washed or generally wobbly about their faith  He gave us FREE WILL  He knows our heart  And He trusts us as we trust Him  Period  It's JUST ENTERTAINMENT (and excellent entertainment at that!)  Now to the show  Yes, Tom Ellis and Lauren German are beautiful and I loved every minute of seasons 1 and 2  Bringing in Tom Welling was the networks' most brilliant move so far this season  While other shows are bleeding characters (Hawaii five-0 comes to mind and others), Lucifer is pushing the ante up by throwing my hero for many, many years, Tom Welling, into the mix and who can argue with Superman? The show revolves around Lucifer, DB Woodside his hunky brother, Amenadiel, and Lauren German as the beautiful cop who starts out trying to catch Lucifer as a criminal but let's say a romance evolves, and Lucifer/Amenadiel's mother, played by Tricia Helfer, who I'm not sure is in this season, and Rachel Harris, total comedy relief is Lucifer's therapist That's pretty much the show - now why I watch it  Simply put: it's pure entertainment  Not heavy, a lot of humor, great ensemble cast, and a far fetched story meant NOT to hurt or help NOT to damage one's own belief  If your faith is that sketchy that what is basically a fantasy show, then I'm afraid you'd better never let your kids watch ANY Disney movie! I live my life out of joy in my faith, not looking over everybody else's shoulder telling them what they should and should not do  And if you all think I'm kidding about being a full on Christian, I will give you my Christian search and final acceptance story including a prophesy gift God gave me during my last operation  NOTHING WILL EVER SHAKE MY FAITH IN GOD AND Jesus Christ  But I am ashamed of many brothers and sisters still in their baby seat, sucking their thumbs, afraid of liberals, afraid of a bad word, afraid of Lucifer! Because I love this show as does my SAVED husband - who actually watched it first 2 years ago and said,  Kathy, you are going to LOVE this show,  to which I responded  HEATHEN! Get thee behind me Satan,  and then here I am, 2 years later writing this  It's one of those  Didn't see THAT coming,  things  I love this show people! Come love it with me! You won't lose your salvation over it! And non-believers, you have no excuse! Also, if you (ABC) Change this winning formula to a darker side of everything: BIG MISTAKE! Don't fix what isn't broken!!

I rarely write reviews but I wanted to add some clarification because fans of the comic are too harsh for this TV series  First this is like 1000 times better than the comic  Yes the comic evolves around a deep , complex , rich story  There is two problems with its story a) its far from original (see Spawn) b) the characters are plain boring  Its very difficult in the comic to differentiate one character from the other , they are miserable and they are also miserable    oh did I say they are also miserable  On the other side we have this TV series  In comparison with the comic is pretty much the polar opposite  The story is extremely simple yet very original , the very few characters that is has very well written , interesting and multi dimensional that do not go down the misery stereotypical writing that anything relate to the devil goes usually  Let's get one thing straight the comic is a drama this is a comedy  No its not a cop show  Yeah sure the theme is cop related but in the end, if you take out Lucifer and Chloe this becomes the most boring cop show you ever watched  The murders investigated are far, far ,far from interesting and they don't play any more than a decoration role for the series  The series has more in common with Californication than it has with CSI , Law and Order etc  It should not surprise its made by the same writer  Essentially this polarises on the relation of Lucifer and Chloe, with every character just being there to push the story further  It also does not glorify Satan by any means  The comic does far better job at that actually  Lucifer is NOT himself  This is something that is made clear from episode 1  First because he decides he is fed up with the role of Satan and wants to explore something else  Second and this is the most important is that he finds, again from very early on, that he is physically vulnerable when he is around Chloe  What is implied is also that he emotionally vulnerable when he is around her as well and the more exposed he becomes to her the more vulnerable he becomes  The final blow on the whole  glorifies Satan  comes when we find in Season 2 why Chloe is so special and why the whole story is far from accidental and has little to do with  the power of love  as you would expect in a typical romantic series  In the end this is too binary to be compared to the comic or a typical cop show and too out of character to be blamed for Satan glorification  For the same reasons it cannot even remotely compare to Supernatural which by the way has a lot more common with the comic than this has  Instead this is a remake of the Californication story and its great remake even though much more simple  Mainly because of the extreme amount of layers that the characters have  But mostly because of the chemistry between Chloe and Lucifer  The show like Californication has much more to do with the human condition that is has to do with religion and mythology  Its semi serious look into the human condition from the perspective of very interesting characters with their own flaws and weakness

What I really love about this show are the one liners that Tom Ellis gets that really make me laugh out loud What I don't like is the obligatory drop dead gorgeous female detective who just stepped off the catwalk  Seriously she is so pure Lucifer is unable to manipulate her like he does every other human, He can also get shot when he's near her, well not in the pilot when he takes half dozen without any ill effects but by the 4th episode he's no longer immortal, that is simply stupid  OK so they want to keep up the fact that he is the devil from her but for how long? So why do American producers always put these dolly birds in these parts? I wouldn't care if they cast someone overweight and less good looking as long as they can act the part So for that reason I've knocked a couple of stars off  Sure it is yet another buddy cop show as some of the negative reviewers have stated  However what can you do new these days? So the elements that make any show a success or failure rest on the characters and the actors who play them, Tom Ellis is simply wonderful and I am so glad he used an English accent (Despite being Welsh)instead of a cod American one

I stumbled across Lucifer by accident, but was hooked immediately  It's one of those shows that you can keep binge-watching and never get tired  The plot is interesting and each episode builds up nicely to a storyline to keep you coming back for more  Can't wait for Season 3  My wife also got hooked after I recommended watching it

I hated the first season because the story was disjointed and the humor was borderline  But season two improved, and this series is worth getting more seasons if the comedy writing holds up  I gave it a generous 8, but I can understand why some people hate this series and I don't have contempt for their viewpoint  When viewer comments were allowed on IMDb, a lot of arguing took place about this series, but it deserves to be seen and the fans deserve more episodes  But it is an acquired taste

8,3/10? Really? Are people really this easily pleased? That is   disappointing  Because what we have with  Lucifer  is a below average police procedural with a cheap gimmick  Nothing unusual there, that's usually how those kind of TV-shows work  But most of those are called out on it  For some reason, this one is being outrageously praised for its shortcomings The titular character of  Lucifer Morningstar  (as he outright tells just about everyone he meets, with all the class and mystique of a Las Vegas street performer who's off his meds) is how the devil would be, as imagined by the least imaginative person on earth  He's predictable, vulgar and cheesy with essentially no REAL self-awareness  Oh, the show pretends that they're hamming it up in a fun, ironic way  But it's pretty obvious they're just churning out another barely mediocre procedural with as little effort as possible The sad thing is, I would probably have enjoyed the concept if it has been executed with some actual talent and genuine panache  They could have played with the idea of the devil walking the street of L A , solving crimes and it would have been a fun little diversion  But unfortunately, they forgot to bring the subtlety and quality writing  So instead we're left with this shrine to the lowest common denominator

I have barely seen better written shows than this one  The dialogues and scripting is superb  The story about heaven and hell, god, the devil and other angels is rich, interesting and there is so much content, that still hasn't really seen a good movie or TV show adaption  This show does an excellent job in delivering interesting approaches to the main questions people ask themselves, when they are thinking about life  Is there a heaven, or hell  What is the devil and how is he like  How does god and the earth, angels and demons and all this stuff connect and work? The bible doesn't really give answers to supernatural beings and the story before creation of earth  Choosing LA (the city of sins) as the main location makes perfect sense  As well as showing the devil making trouble on earth  Amenadiel, Uriel, Mazekeen and Azrael are interesting variations of the classic angels Raphael, Gabriel and Michael  I don't know whether this happened out of respect, or out of creativity, but it works very well  The situations and dialogues happening because of the confrontation of human beings and supernatural ones are hilarious and interesting to watch  This show offers so many likable and interesting characters it is a pleasure to watch

shoots in Vancouver  it would be so easy to move it to L A  and actually shoot in the city it's set in  can't watch it for that reason alone  evidently they intended to shoot there but only for the money are they shooting out of country  return it to Los Angeles, and might be worth watching

Based on characters created by Neil Gaiman, Sam Kieth and Mike Dringenberg, this series follows Lucifer, the original fallen angel, who has become dissatisfied with his life in hell  After abandoning his throne and retiring to Los Angeles, Lucifer indulges in his favorite things (women, wine and song) -- until a murder takes place outside of his upscale nightclub  For the first time in billions of years, the murder awakens something unfamiliar in Lucifier's soul that is eerily similar to compassion and sympathy  Lucifer is faced with another surprise when he meets an intriguing homicide detective named Chloe, who appears to possess an inherent goodness -- unlike the worst of humanity, to which he is accustomed  Suddenly, Lucifer starts to wonder if there is hope for his soul

Their are sooo many reasons why this new TV show should not work For starters, the religious aspects of it  Then you have the done- so-many-times-before teaming up with the police factor  Then you have the typical sexist issues relevant in this show  And so on, and so on  BUT, it did work, and very well so!From the first episode, I had my doubts, but you couldn't help enjoying each character, especially Tom Ellis playing the role of the devil  Combining all of these characters, considering their respective religious earthly roles, then adding the factor of solving crimes, was actually very entertaining Setting this show in Los Angeles and its associated lifestyle/nightlife was a huge plus As the show progressed, I was curious to see what more can happen  Well, a lot did, and it was all executed perfectly Props to the writers and director for finally taking many clichés, and bundling them up, mixing them around and creating a hit TV show!I hope this show keeps renewing its seasons, and look forward to see what happens next!It's a 9/10 from me!

Never in my life have i written a review but this just deserves my full support  I liked the first series and could see so much potential for its future and yes they came up with a far better second series, gratz to the producers, actors and all involved, Please please carry on the good work Also just have to add Tricia Helfer is HOT  Shame she won't be back or will she ?????

Id rather laugh with the sinners than cry with the saints, The sinners are much more fun

I read recently of the armies of trolls attempting to discredit movies/series, some which haven't been released yet?? Looking at the negative reviews I cant help thinking Lucifer is clearly being targeted  I remember looking at some of the posts on the Lucifer Facebook wall and am completely blown out at the 160K likes to some posts in under 24 hours  We're avid watchers  For the most part its almost juvenile, utterly silly and certainly no classic but gosh do we laugh and enjoy the antics  At some level it reminds me of the Beverly Hillbillies and look at how that fill in grew  The negative reviews appear to be more about politics than entertainment  The  ask your mother  comment in Ep 1 had us bellyaching for months, the  Oops  response to killing Lucifers mum was yet another month of mimicking and laughter  I'm delighted to see those attempting to prevent us from enjoying this utterly silly but brilliant piece of entertainment fail

Turn the Devil into the most generic, cringe-inducing man-child, pair him up with a sidekick lady as intriguing as a toothpaste tube, add some juvenile humor, LA landscapes, fancy clubs and overused songs - and you get Lucifer, a product so lame and uninspiring one has to wonder why did they agree to shoot it in the first place  Oh, and I didn't even talk about the biblical aspect in that short summary, did I? That's because if you expect the philosophical stuff about humans and angels, fathers and sons, sin, punishment and redemption, you have the wrong address  And if you're here for absurd dark humor, fresh and weird story lines, and unconventional take on one of the most enthralling characters the mankind has come up with, don't waste your time   Boring  is not the first word that comes to mind when thinking about the Devil, but it describes Fox' Lucifer pretty neatly

This show is amazing! It is my favorite show of all time and can't believe that season one has only four stars and season two has only three  At least that's what Hulu says for star ratings  I hope they make a season three and many more after that  If I could rate it, I would definitely rate it a full five stars

After watching all of the first season of this show, I have to say that I still am not quite sure if I really like it or not  I will note that I have never read the graphic novel upon which this series is loosely based, so my opinion of the show is based on how it is as a stand alone idea  On one hand, there are certain things about this series that I enjoy  Most of the actors bring decent performances to their roles, and Tom Ellis as Lucifer is pretty entertaining to watch  Lucifer is funny and his existential crisis is an amusing subplot  He's also kind of an asshole with chronic foot-in-mouth, but that's part of his character  Chloe is also likable and I'd have to say she's probably the main reason I finished watching the entire season, because I enjoy her character and the family drama she has going on  The uneasy relationship Chloe has with Lucifer is another point that makes the show interesting at times  Contrary to some reviewers, I actually enjoy that Lucifer is kind of a decent guy struggling with the conflict between his perceived nature and the person that he actually wants to be  The show is not without its faults, though  In fact, it has plenty  The writing is mediocre and from other reviews I've read it apparently deviates heavily from the source material  The other main issue is that it's yet another run of the mill police procedural with a supernatural spin (many echoes here of shows like Brimstone, Forever Knight, Moonlight, Reaper, etc)  There isn't much originality here at all and it really drags the show down  If the producers had tried to stick even a little more to the graphic novel then maybe this show could have been something special, but what we got instead is a fairly dumbed-down rehash of a story that's been told by Hollywood many times before  Many of the episode plot lines are shallow and predictable, and like so many other shows these days it tries too hard to be trendy and hip, which detracts from the overall theme  Lucifer as a series could benefit greatly from a little more darkness and a lot less flashy LA club culture  Speaking of LA, I think it's a terrible setting for the show (though, having not read the graphic novel, I don't know if this is where it's meant to be set?)  They could have had this show set in a number of different cities and it would have been a better choice, in my opinion  Despite the complaints I have with this show, I still watched a whole season and I think I may stick around for Season 2, but if there are no improvements to the writing or the other less favorable elements I mentioned above, I don't believe I will continue watching in the long run  This show could have been great in the right hands, but currently it's awfully mediocre and in need of a serious overhaul  I do see some promise in the premise, however, so I'm not ready to write it off just yet

Lucifer is some kind of politically correct new man, a so-called metrosexual  That premise can never work  He has to be bad-ass, offensive, nasty and un-PC  No actor can make devil-as-campy-metrosexual work because it doesn't make sense and is not in any way interesting or fun  He is watchable, at least at first, until his character becomes irritating, but it's not his fault  The same actor would be great in a bad-ass role  Instead the show demands him to be camp and rather pathetic  OK, so Lucifer is a total wet blanket  What are we left with? The female cop  What does he see in her? She's as interesting as a cardboard box  And has zero sex appeal  Also, she sees things that are impossible, comments that they are impossible, but then does not seem curious  Oh, this guy is obviously supernatural, but I'll just sweep that to one side  That is, of course, insanely unintelligent  Then you have the female psychologist - yawn  And the pointless naggy brother angel character, an affirmative-action hire presumably  And the sassy female angel Hell girl, who is also pretty pointless, she's there to protect the Devil? So even his mortality creates no suspense  Oh dear  I watched the first 6 episodes, and then watched the last episode of season two - mostly skipping the many slow bits  The show is dull dull dull and dumb as HELL  Avoid! The show is insipid play-it-safe nonsense, a kind of safe-area for idiots  No guts  No evil

I found this show by accident, and I love it!! The show is full of quick wit and comedy moments, but underneath its full of drama and the love the main characters have for each other is refreshing  Its also a change to see the main character portrayed in a softer light rather than the evil side

I'm in love with this show  It started very good, season one was at the end excellent  Now, in the middle of season 2, I feel obligated to write this Review, because, this is one of the best shows out there at this moment (end of winter 2017)  Actors are great (everyone), screenplay too, but atmosphere and comedy in this show are truly unique  So, people, watch this show, it's renewed for season 3, and I hope it will be in menu season to come  It's intelligent and very entertaining to watch, so do it

I like it  He is charming to look at  I like the little plot twist  The therapist is hilarious  I also like supernatural and was looking for another show that is slightly similar and BOOM this show popped up (along with my friend telling me how its really nice to watch)  I was hoping to binge watch the series but since its still going strong Id keep up with the weekly releases  Suggestion: Please let the mother of lucifer go  She annoys me

Terrifically watchable  How on earth did they do it!?Lucifer should -absolutely- not be on my list of musts  Yet, I haven't missed a single episode  And then can't wait for the next one  What!? This one has really grabbed hold of and kept my interest  And I'm easily bored and hyper-critical, very very few shows manage to meet my standards  This plots been done so many times before, in both television and movies, that it should be growing moss(even the twists are worn out)  Though,I have to say the show has a partly episodic nature(of course), it does have a good, strong story-line that consistently continues throughout Characters are so clichéd, it's criminal  And I'm hooked on every single one's ongoing story line The way they've tried to show us Lucifer's inner thoughts,feelings, inner struggles, is an equally trite and familiar character  A lazy writer's narrative plot tool  But I love it, can't wait see how that subplot continues  The main actor's British accent sounds unbelievable fake  It's utterly charming  (This one was a mystery at first  I knew that Tom Ellis was from Britain - what was going on? After listening to a few interviews and hearing his real voice - he's just really hamming it up more than a few notches for the show  ( Some might think it's because he actually has a Welsh accent But he was just born in Wales, he didn't grow up there) The set designs are beyond cheesy  And yet, their quality is obviously very high - it's easy to see that money and attention was spent here I could go on and on   ---I gave this an 8, but honestly I'm not sure what to rate it  This show has me completely baffled  Why do I like it so much?

I don't usually write reviews but I came here to write one for the people that want to watch Lucifer but are not sure if it's worth it  First thing's first, if you're a religious fanatic and can't set religious beliefs aside to just watch a show it's just better not to  The show is somewhat trying to make you sympathize with the devil so if you can't watch the show as just a show, don't even watch it  Okay, now to the actual review  I'm going to try to make this pretty short (hopefully) and say that Tom Ellis does a really great job at portraying the devil in a way that you wouldn't normally think the devil would actually act like considering you heard all your life he's all the bad in the world  Now a little bit about the plot before I go into more detail about the characters in the show  The plot, I'm going to say that it it's the basic cop movies  There is a case in every episode and they solve it until the end of the episode  Now before you stop reading this review and don't watch the show because of it let me tell you a little bit about the characters in this show  The characters in this show are really unique and setting aside the actual cop cases (cause they are just the means by which the characters evolve) the story is really interesting  The character development keeps you going cause they are in a really unique setting and it keeps you wanting to see what ends up happening  There are many turns and unexpected developments too to keep you interested and believe me, it's working  \Having finished the second season (well    13 episodes are released at the time I'm writing this) I'm left wanting more and really curious as to what happens next  I've finished it 3 days ago and I'm still thinking about what's going to happen  (not many shows or movies make we think about what happens next or of what just happened for days after I finished it) Lucifer, from my point of view, is a show really worth the time  It's nicely written, nicely recorded/edited, really good music and add on top of all of that some really unique and heavy scenes that make you really invested in the characters and empathize with them  Give it a try, I'm confident you'll like it

To be honest I never did any sort of rating or stuff before, but I really like Lucifer  Actually I never read the comics so I had no clue what it's about when I started to watch and maybe I got everything wrong   but I like to imagine that even the devil struggles with human life and all the things that come with it and although the already kind of fell out of heaven, he is also falling a lot of times on earth but still doesn't give up to figure it out and stands up and tries again  It totally weird to imagine the devil running around on earth solving crimes but I like it and I really like to know how everything works out :-)

I gave it a 9 just because Fox wants it canceled   Do not do that Fox mates, just remember the faith of the   Firefox   ; people loves it after the cancellation   Hence the movie feature  So keep it running !

I have been a fan of the supernatural since I was a young boy  This show is utterly ridiculous  A  trying to be funny  Lucifer??? Lucifer is supposed to be the king of hell, dark, demonic, pure evil  I've never seen a Lucifer that smiled so much and in a good mood all the freakin' time  Joking around all the time, blah blah blah Bring back the real evil  The blood thirsty, nasty, black, destructive demons that we all love in the supernatural realm  This show is an insult to the supernatural genre  Hollywood needs a reboot, desperately  All these shows that keep getting pumped out without even caring how good they are  Seriously, have you ever seen sooooo many horrible shows that come out now?? Time to slow it down and come out with a few decent shows  Where have all the good times gone?

Sure   Basically is a kind of B   maybe C TV series   Very Common crime plots stolen from 80's shows, a wild drunken vision of heavenly hierarchies adapted to arrange a story who went very far from the original path and has many weird parts, forced to give air to frequently empty moments  Often a bad air  The heart of everything in my opinion it is the main character  O well   I like characters like Maze or the Doc, but they stay in the background, are their role   the real heart, the reason why this series stays up is Tom  His manners, those little spicy jokes and his English accent, all this make the main character of this series something unique, fascinating as only the devil can be  Not horrible or dangerous, but a little naughty Hellboy, relaxed in a world of noisy, imperfects, strange, faulty and   intriguing humans  Seems he just wont to play a role game on this poor earth but maybe   secretly he wish to be a human   to wash his bones into humanity, to search a place in which found what he missed in hell, just a little of heat, that heat that just only the humans can feel Dunno why but i just can't wait to see the rest   maybe is a demonic spell

I started watching this out of pure boredom with relatively low expectations  Seemed like it was going to be another lame, cheesy take on a supernatural story  I was wrong  Okay   it may be a little bit cheesy but it's extremely entertaining and the writers do a great job of playing its strengths such as clever one liners and well played humor By end of the first episode Tom Ellis will have you completely charmed  Devilish indeed  There aren't many things you won't let the man get away with because he just does it all so well  No other actor could take this material and run with it so brilliantly  Then just when you think he can't get any better Tom jumps on the piano with beautiful performances, some with and without vocals, of very classy choices such as  Sinner Man ,  Unforgiven ,  Knockin on Heaven's Door , and  All Along the Watchtower   The man has the voice of an angel, pun intended Alongside Tom Ellis is Lauren German  I wasn't particularly familiar with her prior to Lucifer and that was my loss  She plays the more serious half of the duo  Despite being the  bad cop  of the two, German is extremely clever, sexy, and quite funny  Her smile absolutely lights up the screen The casting is strong in this one  Mazikeen, portrayed by Lesley Ann Brandt, is a fun and devious demon  Kevin Alejandro does a great job as well playing one of the less gratified roles (in my opinion)  D B  Woodside as Amenadiel and Rachel Harris as Linda are also quite remarkable  Ten stars on this aspect In this decade ruled by giants such as Game of Thrones, The Walking Dead, and the spectacular new Westworld, it's hard to believe this PG-13 rated show can hold its own  Admittedly, I would've liked to see Lucifer without the restraints of the rating holding back all the real life profanity and adult content that we've been accustomed to in recent years  I'm pleased to say that does little to dim the talent and enjoyment of this show  The story holds your attention, the production value is superb, and the performances are top notch  I hope to see many more seasons to come

I won't go into the story because it's basically self explanatory except for Lucifer's relationship with a female cop! The problem with Lucifer is he looses his abilities, which there doesn't seem to have many, when he is in the presence of Chloe, the Botox ridden co star of the show! I am in disbelief how any producer could cast Lauren German when she can't move her face at all! If you mute the TV you would have no idea what's going on! I couldn't figure out why I hated her acting so much until I realized she is both a terrible actor and has lost the ability to show emotion! I really enjoy the main character of Lucifer and his cohorts and find they are the only thing keeping this show going! The story line is full of holes and stupid scenarios so you have to retire your brain while watching 'Lucifer' but the occasional humorous quip from Lucifer keeps me watching  I really wish the writers would add some realistic characters like a psychiatrist who doesn't fall apart when confronted with Lucifer true self! Personally, I would be fascinated with Lucifer and would have many questions but the psychiatrist nearly has a breakdown and doesn't have any questions! A little realism would help shows like this! I am a little surprised Lucifer has been allowed more seasons considering how lame it is but i suppose with the numerous terrible shows around makes Lucifer more attractive to viewers! I would give the show a few more stars if Lauren German wasn't in it and not so annoying and replaced with someone who could actually act, but that isn't happening!

This show has a fun premise and I started watching it to see how the character Lucifer would be interpreted for the TV-watching public  In my opinion, he should be sinfully delicious  So my number-one gripe is I just don't like the main character or the actor playing him, for the following reasons: 1  Too whiny  At least once per episode he whines,  Detective!  I'm no satanist, but I don't picture the Lord of Darkness as a whiny eight- year-old  This reminds me of my students (when I was teaching grade two) saying,  But, miss!  when I wouldn't let them eat candies at morning snack  2  Too ambivalent  They have had a lot of opportunities for the Prince of Darkness to really get all red-eye- glow burned-face furious, and really make the most of those neat special effects from the first episode, but when this devil becomes enraged he just seems kind of peeved  3  Not really that attractive  I get that they were going for a Pierce Brosnan James Bond-type, but Tom Ellis does not ooze sexuality, no matter how many overpriced dapper suits and silk shirts with the top two buttons open they dress him in  Again, he looks a woman in the eye with an air of ambivalence  And he's got a bit of a small chin  4  Rather powerless  Really? Beelzebub, the Evil One, the King of Babylon has the power to make some people admit what they really want, by asking them what they really want? Oh, and he can make a coin with satanic symbols on it float in mid air and spin a little bit  I think it would at least be cooler if he just had to look at you and you admitted your deepest darkest secrets, but then it would be too easy to solve murder cases, wouldn't it? And it irritates him so much that this detective is impervious to his power (also difficult to believe, since he is the Lord of the Underworld and all that) that he starts following her around like a puppy    or maybe an eight year old   Other problems that get in the way of this being the really great show it has the potential to be: 1  Detective Chloe Decker has zero personality  At least give Satan someone interesting to follow around and whine at  2  Detective Dan Espinoza (Detective Douche) has zero personality  3  There is no way that child is the product of Detective Chloe and Detective Douche  So who's the real father? Oops, was that a spoiler? Or did the casting directors flunk out of high school biology and miss the part about genetics? I know this isn't a show about science, it's a show about a very weakly portrayed superstition, but this little casting screw-up makes the viewing public who DID go to high school feel like it's aimed at a somewhat stupider demographic It's kind of entertaining, but I don't think I'll be upgrading my cable package to get access to future seasons

I had low expectations for this series, and TV in general  Now I am hooked  I had to order the full first season on DVD to see how the characters had evolved  Tom Ellis is absolutely perfect for the role  PERFECT  It is impossible to ignore his good looks, but adding in his humor and unexpected display of various emotions, makes this show a winner  I hope the writers are able to continue this delightful mix of good and evil  The dialogue is quick and so very clever  The series is not for the strictly religious - it IS just a TV series after all - but it has served the purpose of creating meaningful discussions between those who believe and those who may be unsure  If you care to look at just one episode before you  pass judgment  - watch A Priest Walks Into A Bar from the first season  It's worth the time  Enjoy!

Tom Ellis acting is the best, Lauren German acting is so great and the chemistry between them is perfect  Lesley-Ann (Mazikeen) is also a good actress for this role !!! Probably one of the best series ever Congratulions to the director and the other actors  The story is very good and the main actors make the scenario explode  For the religious people out there, don't be afraid to watch this show, me too when i first saw  Lucifer  i thought this gonna be bad and blasphemous, but it's cool and OK to watch, nothing to be afraid or bad about God  So it's a must watch show, for the people of all ages and specially for people with a good taste of living and gentleman's manners

After watching a couple of episodes, I couldn't take it anymore  One dimensional characters, noticeably thin plot, very forced situations, and mediocre acting  Not to mention the repeated scenes  How many times is he going to ask her about why she is so different than the other humans and why isn't she fascinated with him?Many of the scenes and character's reactions to what happens to them are pretty unnatural  For example, when Lucifer is confronting the preacher on the street, he says that the preacher is a charlatan, that he doesn't believe in what he is preaching  Now, a natural reaction from the preacher would be to defend himself and deny this, since it's what brings him money  But in the series, he asks in front of many people:  Yeah, so what are you gonna do about it?   It was almost painful to watch There are many other examples, but English isn't my native language, and I'm done wasting my time on this

I've rated movies and series here for at least ten years, but have NEVER written a review     until now  NO, this show didn't start out great and it is certainly NOT for everyone  It was silly from the get-go (and often still is) and the acting was grating at times  But there was just something about it  I decided to give it a chance and am so SO glad I did  I'm totally hooked on it as are many people I know  Tom Ellis is an AWESOME Lucifer  He IS the entire show  He takes some of the cheesiest lines and makes them sound like Shakespearan comedy gold  I'm so invested in his 'story', I'm actually embarrassed  I haven't enjoyed a show this much since Buffy/Angel/Battlestar/etc  Again, this show is far from perfect  But it isn't TRYING to be! Some of the greatest TV comes when you don't try TOO hard  Even Lauren German (Chloe) is starting to grow on me    not crazy about her 'acting'  But she's getting better which is what we all should strive for in life  The other characters are REALLY strong  The psychiatrist, Rachael Harris, is FANTABULOUS! Lucifer's bro is the perfect angst riddled fallen angel  Even Chloe's ex is beginning to grow on me  I am so relieved this show's been renewed, I'd have been devastated to only get one season  Sleeper hits like this don't come around all that often, even these days with yet another 'golden age of television'

I simply love this show! It is amusing, funny, easygoing and lighthearted  The last thing I want to spend my time on is watching gloomy, sad, depressing, so-called realistic  entertainment  that is not entertaining at all  The cast is brilliant and convincing  And they are getting even better with each episode  What Tom is doing with Lucifer is pure magic  I also imagine that he has to have quite a lot of courage to take and create such a devilish character, especially considering that major part of his family is very religious  Thumbs up for him  And for everyone else who in any way contributes to making Lucifer happen  I hope and pray:D for many many more episodes

I was never a fan of crime shows, but now watching Lucifer and how they bring a whole new twist to them is the best  Lucifer brings the seriousness of finding the murderer, while the silliness and comedy you don't see in a normal crime show  Its refreshing to see a new side  I always re-watch episodes on Hulu while waiting for the new one  This is my new favorite show and I enjoy watching it with my whole family  I love that they are building up Lucifer and Chloe's relationship more  I hope to see it blossom into something more than it currently is  The fact that each character faces some kind of personal problem that always loops around and ties back around to either one or more other characters is great  It shows that they are not leaving that character out there all alone

Let's start off with the fact that I am not religious at all and I did not read the comic, so I am able to review this title quite objectively  Lucifer starts of as a quite exciting detective with a little twist, you won't see your average cop duo with an uninteresting story line  In a way, it is actually a bit similar to the show Sherlock  The main character Lucifer is brilliant, his character makes constant references to heaven/hell/religion on a different and funny manner  The fact that he is the only British person in the show (so far) emphasizes the fact that he is 'different' to say the least  Since he is the devil he has some benefits that come with it like being immortal and being able ask for someones deepest desires  These powers, however, have no effect on his partner, a female cop and ex actress  While this idea sounds great, the actress for Chloe could have been played by someone else  Her personality and face are sometimes distracting during intense scenes  The main story line is simple, but interesting and enjoyable  I like the fact that they do not put a label on religion, they do not criticize religion nor do they praise it  They do, however, make the occasional jokes with a religious background like when Lucifer is asked whether Lucifer Morningstar is a real name or stage name, Lucifer replies:  God given I'm afraid   It is these kinds of jokes that make the show the brilliant show it is  I would like to give this show an 8 5, but I am forced to compensate for the sheer amount of negative reviews for religious reasons

As a big fan of the comics I was very disappointment to hear that the TV adaptation was going to do away with pretty much everything I liked in the comics in favor of    Another cop show But    It grew on me, you know? Despite using the cliché murder mysteries as a framing device, the focus is still on the Lucifer's shenanigans and relationships, what makes for a show that is very funny and refreshing  Though most of it feels like an endless party, there are even some genuine emotional moments here and there  Even the clichéd cop mysteries is done competently, if not greatly  To be honest, I never expect great things from this show when it comes up, but I do expect to have one hell of a good time  Pun intended

I missed the complete first season and got to season 2 after the first episode  I certainly wish to see more of it  Lucifer has left Hell to come to our world as a detective fighting crime  Now, if that's not a new idea, I don't know what is  And the devil is a good guy after all, and charming to boot  Of course, dealing with God, his mom and his numerous siblings is quite entertaining  I bet he would have a much harder time composing with various religions on Earth  And who would want to bother anyway? Lucifer is a free loader, but one who doesn't care about material goods  He's enjoying himself, dishing out punishments while humans are still alive  That must be quite a change for him  I can't help but wish he came to Washington to punish rotten politicians, but alas, he got hooked by a pretty detective in the City of Angels  One good, honest cop, he watches over  Lucifer is always a bit frantic  God is always on his tail, so to speak, trying to derail his pleasure train by using humans as pawns for is eternal fight against the Dark Prince  Quite a change of perspective and a refreshing one, even if the whole concept is ludicrous  The good devil also speak with a British accent  Somehow, nobody could believe the show would work with an American accent  I guess the Devil works in mysterious ways too  Lucifer is simply the best show I've seen on TV since «Dead Like Me»

When I first started watching the series, I must admit it was out of curiosity as there were controversies when it was initially aired  I mean, I was wondering how they could possibly make a hero out of  Lucifer  who's BAD NEWS, right? Well, the first season didn't impress much  It was entertaining to a certain degree without any offensive indications to less fanatically religious sectors, from my point of view  They didn't make him your every day hero but ironically despite Lucifer having selfish intentions & ideologies his non-heroic acts turn out to be quite the heroics! The intensity & chemistry between the actors have improved tremendously in Season 2 and the script has definitely improved! Watch this without skepticism and you'll probably enjoy a light hearted action, crime series and remember, this a metaphorically intended show!

The best part of this show is that it is contained with lots of twists,turns and excitement It keeps you focused all the time and curiosity for this show increases time by time The taste of this will never let you be unsatisfied by it This show has got lots of potential to stay in competition To me this episode (The Monster) by far was the best till date as when Lucifer shows what exactly he is? It was a thrill which literally carried goosebumps on my body when the face of hidden Lucifer is shown  I was tumbled at this moment of time as it was an awestruck moment  Her mother is one suspicious character  One important thing is the characters are slowly and steadily being revealed which indicates there's much more to come My Rating for this show is a Total 10 Just waiting for the next episode
